One of the good signs of good restaurants is that they do not even need ads or big signs to make it so noticeable lol. This noodle place is kind of hard to find but I feel so glad we went there. At first I thought this is one of those ramen places...but when we sat down, my husband noticed that the menu is full of all kinds of udon noodle options!! We were not udon people in general, but I convinced hubby to give it a try because this place has amazing reviews on Yelp! I was like " hope I will not regret my decion!" And the reality is...I did not regret at all!! The udon here is so special that it is kind of fun to eat...very chewy and flavorful. We ordered Egg Udon and Curry Udon with Beef! The soup is superb, man...we almost left the bowls completely empty! My husband and I feel so satisfied after we finished...I was like "I can eat another bowl"! Just kidding...I was super full afterwards! The service there is great too! I will definitely go back when I revisit East Village.
No comment
Insane price point, ducking good udon. Ankimo, fried chicken, beers, and two udon with a friend came out to $60. Will come back soon
This place is a little gem, amazing price and amazing food! Perhaps the wine list could be expanded. Try the mackerel sushi and the eggplant!
Best beef udon in NYCï¼ I am very picky on noodles but this time Raku wins! highly recommended! Niku udon is a mustï¼

This is so far my favorite udon place in NYC. I grew up in Japan, and every bowl here brings me back to my childhood. The noodles were perfectly chewy and the broth so savory. I'm salivating just thinking about it!
Both of us had the niku. Im a bit queasy about the tripe but the broth it made was insane.

Yum. Phenomenal. The first time I came to Raku was last December when I was visiting nyc, and it was the #1 on my list of places to go back to. The place is small and they don't do reservations so we did have to wait an hour (group of 4), but who cares? Go grab a drink, you're in the east village. I will wait that hour for this delicious udon. One of the friends I was with is vegan, and they had plenty of good options. Any time I'm in the city I will make sure to come here. Do it. Also, they're cash only, but they do have an ATM in the restaurant.
Pretty good place. Newly opened. Cozy atmosphere. Food is good. Udon noodles look like hand made. Soup pretty good, not too heavy even for curry udon. Worth trying out.

Little difficult to find, there's no signage on the exterior. Also, the menu does not have clear explanations for what the food is and the cash only is a real turn off. It is 2015 and New York City, who the heck doesn't take credit cards? Â Service was average. Short rib beef was excellent, but the soup had subpar flavor.

The place was pretty small, simple designs. Order the Niku Udon, Agedashi Tofu, and some wine. The beef from the Niku Udon was flavorful, and the udon was chewy. (Although not made in-house, it was handmade and shipped from Japan.) The tofu was light in saltiness, but soggy (would have preferred the shell to be crunchy). The wine brought out the taste of the beef (so I would recommend ordering some wine).
No comment
some of the best udon I've ever had, the noodles were super chewy and the beef broth was great

Excellent udon. I had the curry udon with beef and it was flavorful without being oily, with great texture to the noodles. The staff was friendly and attentive. Not a bad wait on a Tuesday night. Definitely coming back to try other things on the menu!

Had the Niku Udon and Miyasaka Yawaraka sake. The Niku Udon was decent, but the noodles were very, very delicious, slightly chewy and almost perfect. Although I wasn't a fan of the sweet broth I did enjoy the texture of the tripe and the way the brisket fell apart. The daikon had been soaking in the broth so made a nice burst of flavor that balanced out. Paired with the sake made a wonderful meal.
No comment
No comment

I went there based on the yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. Ramen was good, but not exceptional therefore only 3 stars. Place itself is nice but very small, only a few tables, but when we got there there was plenty of free space and service was really fast.
BESTT udon!!! The noodles are so authentic and soft and chewy, and the broths are all so comforting on a cold day. I will def be back!!!
Amazing Udon noodles are so fresh. Â They get it from Japan. Â Great appetizers also. Â It's worth the wait!

Great dinner yesterday at Raku. Â Small menu of appetizers, udon, and donburi dishes. Â The star is obviously the udon, which had the most perfect, silky smooth texture and just the right amount of chewiness. Â I had the kamonan udon, cooked to perfection with a flavorful and light broth. Â My friend had the niku udon, which was also delicious but with a heavier, heartier broth. Â Agedashi tofu and chicken karaage were also stellar and worth a try. We left completely full and satisfied. Â Having lived in Tokyo for several years, I have super high standards and this place impressed me! Â Service was friendly, polite, and unobtrusive. Â Space is small, and even though we didn't have to wait for a table for 3 at 7pm on a Wednesday night, I definitely see this place getting crowded!

Love their Udon dishes, the broth is so rich in flavor and the noodles had perfect texture. My favorite so far are the ebi tempura and the wagyu beef Udon. The curry Udon was less to my liking. I love the minimalist decor. Don't forget to join the wait list on yelp.
Udon like no other .. Tofu alone worth the trip, Tried the Niku and Herring. Brilliant

Neat place for the delicacy of the food. We ordered three different types of ramen and some appetizers. The appetizers were karage and monkfish liver, both were outstanding. The flavors of the udon broth were delicious. The texture of the noddles were chewy and flavorful.

Went here on August 13th on a day trip to NYC with my boyfriend. The interior was very well-designed and aesthetically pleasing, although a bit small (If you go, make sure to go early, around 6 or 6:30). We ordered the edamame, which was much more tender and fresh than what we usually get at our local sushi place, and the hijiki for appetizers. Both were absolutely delicious. For udon we ordered niku udon and gyunan udon. I had the niku udon, and I loved the fragrant broth, the soft honeycomb tripe, and the flavorful pieces of beef. It was very filling, soothing, and easy on the stomach. My boyfriend also really liked his gyunan udon. We went into Raku with very high expectations based on reviews we had read, and they were definitely met/exceeded. Definitely recommend!!!!!

The noodles' texture is not something that can be achieved from anything store bought. Whether cold or hot, amazingly chewy and springy, the best udon I've had in the city. Usually I prefer soba but this has converted me. The short rib and tripe was so tender and rich without being greasy or heavy (short rib carefully trimmed of fat), the broth was so good I finished it all. The staff are great and very accommodating. We have a 3 year old and they're kind enough to provide plastic utensils and cup with lid and straw. The sides are all good but the noodles are the star. They only accept cash, but they also have a really cool looking atm inside a cabinet if you forgot beforehand.
No comment
The best udon place in NYC.... The only thing that I don't like is no plastic is accepted.... cash only....
No comment
No comment
We ordered agedashi tofu, niku udon and pork cutlet rice. All of them were tasty. The thick cut beef in niku udon was so soft that just melt in your mouth. Really enjoyed the food there.

Wonderful little spot. Â With great soups. Had the beef rib and tripe udon (must have been the Dominican in me calling out!). It was flavorful and had plenty of tripe and beef. limited menu. Not too many tables. But very cozy. Service was attentive. Will be back!
The best udon I've had. I evangelize about this place to anyone who asks me for a restaurant recommendation -- and they've gone on to spread the word themselves! Also super affordable.
Beautifully simple, small space. Feels like a place on the canal in Kyoto. Totally authentic. Friendly staff. Fair prices. Go.
Probably one of the best Japanese food around. Feeling very lucky to have found this place before it becomes popular (and no doubt that it will).
Their curry udon and tatsuta age are life-affirming. This bowl of noodles will change your life. Wow.

Best udon I ever had!!! Never knew that udon can be this delicious! The noodle here has wonderful texture. You'll definitely love it. I ordered curry udon and my husband ordered niku udon-- both are so good. Highly recommend!

Homey, comfortable, delicious. Â Shrimp tempura udon was prepared perfectly - everything from the tempura batter to the udon texture to the soup broth. Â Staff was very friendly and helpful. Â The restaurant is small and fills up quickly, so go early!

I have not had a lot of udon. Â But it was the best udon I have ever had. Â I had the tofu udon and the tofu was amazing and so were the noodles. Â Super fresh with a great texture that I have not had before with udon noodles. Â About $10 for the vegetarian bowl. Â The vegetable gyoza were great. Â Hard to find--wooden door with two black curtains covering it and the restaurant seats about 25-30 so you may have to wait. Â People were waiting right inside the restaurant and we waited about 10 minutes for 3 people on a Monday night. Â It's the best I've ever had so five stars.

Enjoyed the theme! (Yin and Yang) Place is a bit hidden but once you get in you'll feel comfortable. The chop sticks were official! I got the curry beef udon with fried chicken appetizer, absolutely delicious. Check this place out.

As an avid noodle lover, raku has the best noodle by far. Their noodle is unique and al dente, you get that bounce everytime unlike other places who serve soft noodles. Their broth are also very flavorful yet clear and light. The ambiance makes me feel like i'm in japan! Only downside is i wish they gave more meat but definitely worth it :)

This place is so amazing! The udon is cooked to the right consistency--not too chewy and not to hard. The broth is flavorful and will have you drinking all of it. My favorite is the kamonan udon! The duck does not feel dry and the soup is very clean. Get the duck!
The broth was so clear and refreshing. A lot of flavor. The noodles were chewy. I can't wait to go back.
had the tripe soup, kind of clean and minimal like the dining room, fat gelatinous noodles and a discreet broth. overall 3 and 1/2 stars
No comment
No comment
Exterior, interior, location, atmosphere, quality of food, portion is all good enough to bring a friend who's visiting nyc or loves asian food and culture. Absolutely love this place.

I got the mushroom udon and thought it was really good - the broth was flavorful, especially for something all vegetarian. The noodles were a great chewy consistency and silky texture. My friend got curry udon and couldn't stop talking about it. We were in a rush and she insisted on inhaling all of the rest of the noodles. Definitely recommend.
We had the curry udon and the chikara udon, both delicious. The place is cute and simple. Good service, zen atmosphere, large selection of udon noodle soups. We will come back.

This place is definitely a hidden gem. While Â the restaurant is small and waiting for seating may seem like forever, this place is worth it. I gave it 5 stars for the food. I'm not someone who's crazy for udon, but this place has to be my favorite spot. There's something authentic about it. Anyway, if you like asian/oriental food and you're craving soup, I highly recommend giving this place a try!
This is the BEST UDON place in my life! The soup base is wonderful. Noodle is unique. It is adequately chewy. Service was good too. I waited thirty minutes to get food, but I don't regret it.

Had the niku udon, because it's the most recommended bowl according to the yelpers. And I love me some tripe. The tripe/meat was cooked to perfection. They are very generous with the amount of meat they put in it. However, its a bit pricey, BUT still worth it.
Walked in on a Sunday afternoon with my boyfriend and we were seated immediately. Loved the space. Amazing udon broth. This place is definitely a Yelp bookmark worthy spot.

The best udon I have ever had. Pretty sure they handroll their udon. The broth is tasty, not too salty and they are not skimpy on the meats and veggies unlike other udon/ramen places. I got the tripe/pork meat udon and it had like 3 large pieces or tripe and 3 large pieces of pork meat. It was delicious. Very cozy atmosphere. Can get a little crowded and is hard to find but overall great food and customer service.

Best udon spot in the city. Noodles are spongy and thick, broth is flavorful and rich but not too heavy. The chilled noodles are also worth it. For appetizers try the tofu or fried chicken. It's the best deal in the city (30$ pp for apps mains and sake) and the atmosphere and service is perfect for an intimate low key night. It is small though so best for small groups.

People have been telling me to come to this place for a while and now I know why! It was a little confusing to find because it's very unassuming outside but once you come in the door behind that little blue and white flag you are instantly charmed. I was instantly hit with the delicious aroma of their food and the beautiful and simple minimal aesthetic. The mild curry udon noodle with beef is DELICIOUS and just perfect for the chilly weather that day. The noodles were the perfect texture and intermingled with the curry broth beautifully. Best udon I have had in New York.
Clean, well presented Japanese dishes at reasonable prices! The egg drop soba was particularly interesting.
Best Udon. Hands down. You can't go wrong either eat-in or get delivery. Just note, it's a small space and there can be a long line depends on when you go.
No comment
This is our second time here. Just as good as first time. Udon is so delicious. Niku (beef ribs and honeycomb tribes) is most flavorful. Other udon soups are just as good.

My friend and I were looking for ramen around St.Marks and we found this place on yelp... not quite ramen but it is like a hole in the wall for udon! I got the short rib noodle and we ordered the fried chicken for appetizer. The chicken was so tender and juicy we wanted seconds! The short ribs noodle soup was so delicious. The broth is very refreshing and flavorful and the short ribs are so tender. The udon tasted so fresh. Definitely will come back again!

Ate here for lunch yesterday and had the Niku Udon (beef short ribs and honeycomb tripe). The udon was good and the broth was flavorful. The meat was tasty too. Overall it was a solid meal. I liked how it was a peaceful little spot with nice decor. Give this place a try if you're in the neighborhood!

Went there and tried the beef short rib with honeycomb tripe. The soup was amazing - the udon was less chewy than what I prefer. But overall it is definitely worth the wait. We went next door to the Peruvian restaurant for happy hour as we waited for a table.
Simplistic casual ambience, with high quality utensils. Great udon noodles, with a tasty rich broth (niku udon). Would be back!

This restaurant has all kinds of udon and some appetizers. Very different from the udon should might have in other Japanese restaurants. You can feel the handmade-ness with chewy texture and the soup base is good too. Service is very friendly.
Some of the best authentic Udon in the city! Service is great and prices are reasonable. Love the Mushroom and wakame udon and fried tofu appetizer. Definitely a place to check out.

Had lunch at Raku, new favourite noodle joint. Had the monkfish liver to start and beef shortribs udon. The udon noodles were a game changer - perfectly chewy. Definitely coming again the next time I'm in the area.

After once sushi lunch, eating a professional udon came in my mind. I can not say I am the expert of udon, but I do really know about the noodle, ramen etc. Raku's udon is the best one I have ever done. kk.... Â Help u guys will have same thing. Â PS. Beef udon I chose.
The soup noodles are super tasty, so is the fried chicken appetizer, must have. Â  Staff is very friendly and considerate of the customers.

I came twice here because the store looks authentic, and the good reviews on yelp. But the food I got are just soso. I think the noodle itself was good, tempura was ok but not so good, chicken karage was ok but nothing special, I don't really like the taste of the soup. I expected better because of the good reviews but....
Great spot for lunch. Â Go early, or prepare to wait a bit. Â The curry udon.... sooooo good on a cold rainy day! Â The fried chicken was great as well, but the udon is the highlight for sure.
I have went there for my birthday back in October 2015, I was treated by some co-worker, I love this place, the food was so delicious, I would recommend to anyone. Wonderful!!!!
Just moved upstairs and tried this little shop out for the first time. Everything was delicious: the noodles were fresh, the fried chicken hot and juicy and the service was very polite.

Food and service were awesome. I had the recommendation of udon, since I didn't want the honey comb, with the wagyu beef and the broth was flavorful yet clean. I went there for lunch, 10 minutes before it opened and it was almost basically full. The place is small, but cute.
Favorite udon spot in nyc so far! Noodles are consistently good and the broth is flavorful yet not overwhelming.

I used to go to Sake bar hagi and ippudo ramen for finger food and noodle but at the end of the day, it wasn't enough for me. However, Raku is the right place to eat japanese noodle and appetizer, since they have perfect menu. I tried curry udon and bacon for lunch. The Udon's texture is chewy and soft at the same time and amount of food is enough. The taste of food is excellent, but what this store actually does to you is to make you relaxed by food and gentle mood. Price is reasonable. Highly recommend this restaurent. I still can't believe that I can try these kind of food in NYC. I stay happy throughout the day! best!

This place is beautiful! I fell in love with the decoration in the outside and couldn't help myself but walk in. The inside also had very clean and unique design. As much as the exterior and interior design lured me in, the Udon also did not disappoint. I think the best one on the menu is the Curry Udon. Other than the curry I tried the mochi udon and although the broth and noodles were perfect, the mochi wasn't quite my cup of tea.
really nice setting and atmosphere. cozy and small. udon was good but could've done with a little bit more flavor
Good restaurant. I have to say that their udon portion is HUGE. And their appetizers are also very tasty. Â But they are cash only.

Love this restaurant. The simple, elegant, clean atmosphere and the waitress at lunch was fantastic. Such a prime example of great service and fresh food. Everything was fantastic. It really tastes as if my mom had made it...and everyone knows homecooked meals are the best. I will tell everyone about this place. BRavo
100% love it! Best noodle ever! I have been there many times and every time they made me surprise. Super good udon and the fired chicken taste super good. I recommend niku udon!
Had half a bowl of cold udon without soy sauce.... it was completely untasteful. Then the clerk said they forgot to put soy sauce. Words failed me.
Best gyoza I've ever had. The udon was great -- I recommend the spicy chicken curry one. The vibe is a bit pretentious but it's worth it.
udon is the best..the construction outside a lot of noisy.... only cash....

The restaurant is a little out of the way and can be easy to miss if you're not looking for it. The inside is also small so it's not great for parties larger than 4. I came with a friend later in the afternoon so we were seated right away. We decided to share chicken tatsuka-age and a gyunan udon with a poached egg and extra udon noodles. The chicken was juicy and served with a spicy mayo sauce. I wish they had given us more mayo as it was gone after the first two pieces of chicken. The udon was very good. The noodles had a nice chew and you could definitely tell that they were freshly made. Also, the bowl of udon is huge. You can't tell through the pictures on Yelp, but it is big. While this place can run pretty steep for just a bowl of udon, a hack would be to share a bowl with a friend and order extra noodles or even toppings to stretch your dollar. I will definitely be frequenting this place in the winter or if I want a break from ramen.

I would not come here again. Â First, they only accept cash, and that's a real pain. Â The caraffe of hot sake was admittedly very good, but at $34 too expensive, and difficult to pour. Â My main complaint was the shrimp and eggplant tempura udon. Â I admit the noodles were delicious, and the broth excellent (not too salty), but they only gave you two shrimp and left the freakin tails on! Â I hate that! Â Remove the tails! Â I don't want to be pulling a soupy tail off of my shrimp. Â And only two, be more generous please. Â And ONE, ONE piece of eggplant. Â Skimpy. Â And for $14.

Finally made my way here after a friend's recommendation. It's nice overall, but nothing too surprsing, and I am not a fan of Niku Udon (beef tripe). I could have given 4 stars if I had something else. Also, this place is cash only.

I have never been much of an udon fan but this place has me hooked. I have never been disappointed in anything I have ever ordered here. The staff and owners are extremely helpful and friendly. My go to dish here has been the Niku Udon. It is a nice sized bowl. Deep rich broth. Nice pieces of short rib and tripe. The noodles look hand pulled with a nice soft yet great chew in the texture. This is true comfort food at its finest. Keep up the good work and see you all soon.

My wife and I got there and they told us 10 min wait. We offered to wait outside in the drizzling rain so we aren't in the way. A couple came and went straight in and were seated. We had to ask and they told us that they had put their name on the list previously. Totally fine. Then, another couple came after us, deliberated whether they should eat here and then finally went in to wait. Then, a group of four came and one of them went in to ask the wait situation. They were given a table immediately bc a table of four just left. However, the tables are by couple so the restaurant could have totally split the tables and sat us and the couple after us. Instead, they chose to sit the four that came after all of us. A few more minutes later, they sit the couple that came after us. That was the last straw and we left. I had eye contact with the hostess a few times and she did not offer to explain the situation. We probably waited for 25 minutes. This is completely unacceptable and we will never be back.
Delicious food, but too sweet. We ordered both rice and udon. We got tired of the sweetness when we almost finished it.
Theres not much else to say other than thia place ia the best. The beef and curry udon is on point. The chicken is amaZing. Love love love
good foods but terrible service, honestly they're kinda racist, good service for white people but for others... won't go again.
Best udon in the City. It is Kura's sister restaurant and its does not disappoint. Best of all, the tastiness of the broth matches the quality of the noodles. An important combination.
we ordered curry udon with Mochi...very delicious. I think I'll have been there many times
Amazing food in very simple and gorgeous presentation. The BBQ eel over rice was delicious.

Really fantastic! Came here on Tuesday and absolutely loved it. We shared some appetizers- vegetable gyoza, fried chicken both were delicious. Then I had the shrimp tempura ramen with a side of Mochi and thought it was excellent. Huge fan and can't wait to come back.

This is hands down the best udon restaurant I have been to in NYC. I had the bacon app and the Niku. The spiced bacon is a thick cut and just sublime. The hand pulled noodles are super fresh and light in the Niku. The homemade broth has nuanced flavors that bring out the best in the tender beef. Highly, highly, recommend.

I visited Raku since long time back but today I get a chance to share my experience over here, and I must say my experience was really amazing and I still remember the taste of fried chicken which I ordered was so juicy and I believe it is the best fried chicken in the city.

Like others here, I hesitate to let the world know about Raku because I want it all to myself! Walk along 6th Street between Second and Third Aves, a typical lower east side stretch of old buildings and old restaurants, and suddenly you come to this clean, very Zen-like facade, and you know you're there. Inside is a cozy, 26-seat restaurant that serves huge bowls of warming udon noodles and other classic Japanese fare. If you eat meat, order a side of bacon with whatever main dish you choose from the small but varied menu. If you don't eat meat, you will still be able to find something delicious on the menu. There are no bad choices.

I got the chance to try the food here last night when a dear friend of mine took me. I tried the ankimo (monk fish liver) and the niku udon (beef noodle soup) - both exceeded my expectations. The soup turned out to be a perfect blend of flavors that I've never encountered before. I've had it several times around the US and even in Japan, and I must say it's one of the best I've ever tried. It was easy to tell that the ankimo was prepped by a professional. The seasonings on it were just the right consistency, and the presentation was 5-star worthy. The only bad thing I noticed was the crowd - the tables here are very close to each other, and it got so crowded soon after we sat down to the point where we didn't really have any privacy. I could notice that the people on the table next to us could listen to our conversation without even trying, and we we're speaking in a pretty quiet tone. I would probably come back here, but not after 5pm because judging from my first visit, that's when guests start pouring in. I'm very glad that this spot is near my apartment though, it's definitely praise of worthy, the food is so good it'd be a sin to miss out on it.

I was really expecting the cream puffs to be mind blowing but there were quite average to me. They are definitly really cute which I understand why there was so much hype surrounding this dessert shop. However, I found my new goto place for iced vanilla lattes. I had a iced vanilla latte 2 years ago and the cafe shut down. Ever since then I have been trying to find a vanilla latte that tasted close to the one I had and I was alwyas disappointed. This cafes vanilla latte is amazing and I am so glad I decided to give it a try.

I love cream puffs, so naturally when I saw a new cream puff spot opened I had to try. The space is cute, a decent size and there are a few tables inside for you to sit down and enjoy your pastries and puffs at. I tried the banana chocolate, tiramisu, black sesame, and ube. I'm a big fan of chocolate and banana so it's no surprise that my favorite was the chocolate banana flavor. The ube one had a very subtle ube flavor, the black sesame and tiramisu fillings were equally as good. The cream puffs are small enough so you can buy a few more to try and not be too full. Priced decently. Loved the texture of their crust. They're best enjoyed as soon as you purchase them so the crust won't get soggy I would think. I'll definitely be back to try their other pastries.

Such a fun snack and drink stop! The kids found this place online and we finally got a chance to visit. Very cute little cafe, clean and organized. Nice clean restroom for customers. They are doing very well handling the busy-ness of the cafe as well. No long lines. The food and drinks were all very good. We tried the unsweetened tea, a matcha latte, and a coffee latte. The food was delicious! We tried 2 flavors of the amazing cream puffs, rose lychee and tiramisu. We tried a cranberry scone and a matcha cream filled croissant. We were impressed with all of the above and will definitely return!

Butter Dose is a cute bakery that sells not only pastries but savory food. They had a bunch of options and everything looked so good that I had trouble choosing. I went with one of their pastrami crossant sandwiches and I thought it was pretty tasty. I also enjoyed their matcha creampuff, but I especially loved their strawberry matcha latte. It's so rare to find a place that's both cute and tasty so I was pleasantly surprised with this one. I'll most likely be back if I'm in the area!
No comment

what a cute inside of the store! everything is bright yellow and has such a cute logo / design. the cream puffs are less than $5 and are all so cutely designed! we got the yuzu and strawberry sakura which was a seasonal puff. the puff pastry itself was not sweet but the filling was really light and creamy, and i loved the strawberry and mochi inside
No comment

Small underrated bakery specializing in cream puffs and this place satisfied my sweet tooth after dinner! The size of the cream puffs are pretty small, but I thought this was enough for me. These aren't too sweet and they're well flavored. I would've never expected an Asian inspired bakery from the outside! I'll definitely have to come back to try the other flavors and pastries. They have some small tables to catch up with a friend or do some work. The workers are really nice and helpful. I believe their coffee is by Coffee Project, so they definitely have quality drinks as well!
No comment

I stumbled upon this place as I was walking through the neighborhood and decided to check it out since I was craving something sweet. As soon as you walk into this place it is bright, spacious, and the atmosphere is welcoming. Long story short I ordered one of each because my a** is greedy haha I was expecting the desserts to be very sweet, but I'm glad it wasn't which was a plus. When I normally eat a lot of sweets I feel disgusted but this left me satisfied and fixed the craving I had. I recommend anyone that is in the area to try this place out. I will return whenever I'm around.

The place is so cute with all the yellow. Staff was really nice and helpful. Appreciate all the different flavors of cream puff. 3.75 each but personally for me they were small and the cream was super sweet. I got lychee rose and strawberry Sakura!!
No comment

Made a quick stop during the afternoon with a friend. The outside of shop is easy to spot and the interior is even cuter. It was pretty busy so all seats were taken, they had a good selection of pastries which looked yummy but I went for their cream puffs. I got a matcha and tiramisu cream puff and they were both really tasty. The to go box was adorable and by the register they have free stickers that you can take! My friend and I each took one. I want to go try the rest of their pastries next time k go!

Never went into the actual store so this review is based purely on the desserts, but got a box of these from family and their cream puffs are fabulous y'all! We tried the chocolate banana, sesame, lime (key lime?), and tiramisu flavored ones and they came in a cute box - and decorated very nicely too. They're small but tasty and make such a nice gift.
No comment

Amazing new find in NYC. This bakery is gorgeous and the staff is so nice and friendly! The cream puffs, cookies and muffins were incredible! This place is a chocolate lovers paradise! Definitely will be back to try all their other beautiful treats!
No comment

This recently opened bakery in east village is so cute! The interior is really brightly decorated and there's a few tables, although they were all full when I came around 4 PM on a Saturday. There were a decent number of people inside, and some of the flavors were sold out. We got the black sesame and seasonal strawberry Sakura cream puffs, and they were both really good. I was surprised because only the cream on top of the puff is flavored, and the filling inside is just vanilla, but the flavors still came through. I especially loved the black sesame, since the flavor was really rich and strong. The strawberry one was solid, but I couldn't really taste the Sakura. They're pretty small and a little expensive for the price, considering you can get larger ones for only one or two more dollars at Alimama or Bibble and Sip, but I still really enjoyed them. Definitely want to come back to try their drinks and other baked goods (the croissants, cookies, and scones all looked amazing as well)!

Unique seasonal cream puff flavor: strawberry sakura! I wish I could finish it in more than 3-4 small bites because it was great! The iced strawberry matcha latte was also good, but I wish the strawberry flavor was a bit stronger.

Such a cute little spot to get coffee/tea and dessert! The service was great and staff were extremely friendly. We got to try the rose lychee, black sesame, chocolate banana, and the yuzu. I also ordered the strawberry hot chocolate which was absolutely insane and the matcha latte. The cream puffs were as good as they looked and the strawberry hot chocolate was my absolute favorite. The cafe has great vibes too and I loved the yellow tables! Thank you for your hospitality.

New cafe in the east village/ Union Square adjacent. Great/friendly service, super reasonable coffee, great tea options, and even better desserts. The cream puffs and scones were amazing, which not surprising when you consider that all things are baked by their trained pastry chef. To top it all off the vibe of the place is chill, great amount of seating, WiFi, and a clean bathroom. Perfect for a friend date, regular date, Â to get some work in, or people watch from the window counter seats.
Definitely worth coming here for some coffee and desserts. Great place to hang out and study as well. Great staff and atmosphere.

Really good lattes & goodies! Well-known for their cream puffs which I haven't tried yet, but the prosciutto croissant sandwich was so good! A bit small but nice place to study if you're okay with some noise :)

Cute new cafe that opened up near union. Loved the decor and interior design- super cute. Their drinks were mid to be honest- wasn't impressed by the matcha and hojicha latte. Their cream puffs were cute and okay- puff was fresh and the cream inside was tasty.

A cute cafe spot with nice decor! Went with some friends and the cream puffs were delicious. Their oat pistachio latte was creamy and strong in pistachio flavor. The service was quick and friendly. Would make plans to return here again!

The white male cashier at the front was very rude (basically threw the spoon at me when I asked for another utensil) and was not helpful when I asked questions. Â It was a super cute place and the desserts weren't overly sweet which I liked, but I wouldn't come back because of the service.
Very cute new bakery. Â Cranberry scone is a must. Â Not too crazy about cream puff. Very tiny and pricy. Blueberry muffin is ok. Â Excellent customer service.

I like the interior decor and pastry options however their matcha latte wasn't made well. Needs to be heated and stirred before adding to milk option to dissolve better. But still check out this shop for a cozy bright meeting

Super cute and aesthetic cafe! I saw a Korean's girl's tiktok, she said this cafe very much reminded her of south korea! it's small, with cute decorations. the coffee and a the pastries are delicious!!

WOW!! Let me just say, customer service is excellent and the treats are so so good. I was helped by a woman with dark short hair and she was so kind and engaging, even telling me about the bakery's menu items when I mentioned I had worked at a bakery. She also offered to make a couple things fresh for me that had sold out prior. She was so warm and delightful. Just because of that interaction I'll be back again. Kudos to her !

came in for a quick bite before an appointment and oh my gosh is it good. i got the chicken coleslaw biscuit and they warmed it up for me and it is a 10/10 it's such a cute and clean spot with great prices and service will be coming back
Really cute place and friendly service. Had the rose lychee which was refreshing and true to flavor. Would definitely come here again
Great oysters!! Loved the rolls as well. Totally recommend their cocktails as well!!!!

This is a nice spot for an intimate dinner. We ate the Wagyu Filet Mignon, Wagyu Tartare, and Wagyu Truffle Roll. All three items hit the spot for our wagyu craving tonight.
No comment
No comment

Have been wanting to try this place ever since seeing their uni filet minion. This restaurant is worth the $$$. The service and food were all delicious. Every single thing we got was so good. My favorite two dishes were actually the sesame crusted salmon and the crab cakes. We also got the cheese fries which were a good side and the portions were quite large. The uni filet minion was so yummy and the steak melted in your mouth. The salmon roe and seaweed sauce were so savory and complimented the steak well. It was definitely pricey ($192) but the portion size is large and you can definitely share it with another person.
No comment
No comment

A casual yet swanky restaurant in Brooklyn. We started with charcoal edamame, which was smokey and perfectly salty. We ordered the seasonal lobster Raviolo, which was one big ravioli made with lobster and pumpkin puree with a soup. For the main entrees, we ordered the Prime Wagyu Steak which was A5 Wagyu beef with ponzu sauce and various condiments on the sides (sea salt, garlic chips, wasabi, and schezwan peppercorns). Steak was beautifully cooked. Â Additionally, we ordered lamb chops with a hollandaise sauce and miso mille feuille potato. Definitely great for a special event or date night.

We were excited to try it. A friend was a repeat customer. Ordered the most premium steaks and uni toppings with a tab over $500, was really disappointed in food, really underwhelming steak, bland flavor and shockingly lacked salt completely for them. Would not go back
No comment

Great atmosphere and even more amazing food. Wagyu was so buttery soft and delicious it should be illegal. The server was very thorough in explaining how to eat the meat with the different pairings. We ended up loving the filet most, will be recommending to friends and family to come for special occasions. Certainly a splurge but well worth it

No comment

Rich Japanese steakhouse and grill with top-tier meats and associated condiments/appetizers that make for a fancy but not over-the-top dinner experience. It is WAGU heavy! $60 a person. 4.75/5 stars as a dinner spot.
No comment
No comment

Just got back from this cute spot in Williamsburg for a nice evening out. Ordered the NY strip (14oz) , market fish which was a whole branzino, and side of shishito peppers. Overall, delicious meal and would recommend for a nice date or a group dinner. Staff was nice and attentive to refilling our glass. The branzino was moist and flavorful. Â Shishito pepper was Amazing! It was definitely salted & charcoaled; had a great smoky flavor. NY strip was done as requested medium well, however the "side" of watercress was bland. Not sure if it was meant as a garnish or actually meant as a side salad. Considering the steak was still, a simple dressing drizzled over the watercress would've sealed the deal for me. The only other annoying thing was the 2.7% credit usage fee which was not mentioned prior until the bill came. So bring cash, if you do decide to come!

Ordered everything. Overall, tasted wonderful. Fries were mediocre, drinks were average. Not a knock, but it doesn't smell or feel like a traditional steakhouse if that's the vibe you were looking for. Doors on both sides of the restaurant were open, so there was a lot of street noise. And also someone who threw a container of water at our table in a hit and run. Luckily our orders didn't arrive yet, but the server just gave us extra napkins. Good ol' NYC. Overall solid, but unlikely to come back given the price point.
No comment
No comment

I've been wanting to try salt + charcoal for quite some time now. Overall the food was decent but it wasn't wow-Ing or spectacular in my opinion. Starting with the appetizers, the crunchy oysters was very refreshing. It's a must order. Their wagyu sushi, salmon rolls, and uni and wagyu sushi is also delicious. Moving onto the steak entrees, I was a little disappointed at how the steaks came out because it was barely warm when it was served to our table. My friends and I came on a Sunday night at 9pm. It wasn't too busy so I'm not sure why our steaks came out disappointing. The duck breast was uncooked to our tasting. Overall, salt + charcoal is worth trying but not the best to me and my friends.

Had a reservation for 6pm and the restaurant wasn't too busy. We came here to try the steak for two and it was cooked a perfect medium rare! The steak was flavorful and delicious. We wanted to order the steak tartare as well but unfortunately we were not able to do so because there was no sushi chef to prepare it for the day. The baked potato was alright, nothing special about it. The star of the show was the steak. I would recommend getting the steak when you come here!

We went on a weekend night and made reservations in advance. We had 5 people sitting indoors down in the wine cellar at the best table the round table booth. We shared the lobster, steak for 3 and the following sides - special vegetables, onion and cheese fries. I would say onion and cheese fries is a must to get. The one item I would like to see expanded is the wine lists as it was lacking on selection and maybe this is because of the extensive sake offering. I opted for a cocktail or two instead and they were great - try the salt + charcoal cocktail.
No comment

I have been driving past this restaurant for years. I finally tried it. My favorites dish is the cheese fries very delicious. The marinade onion is unique but I don't think I am going to order it again. I also a the Wagyu beef sushi roll with black truffle it was okay. I am going to order the steak next time and of course the cheese fried. Their desserts are good also.

Love this gem of a restaurant. Food is always on point and service is always attentive to all details. I've eaten 2 orders of the crab cake and plan on doing it again soon. Can't go wrong with the crunchy oysters ( save the dipping sauce for the fries and veggies ) and of course, the NY strip is always on point
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was incredible. Probably the best steak I've had in a while. The waitress who served us was really kind and the staff was very attentive to us during the entire meal - cleaning the table after every course, refilling out water and tea etc. I loved the vibe of the place as well. The music was very soothing and the place was dimly lit with candles. Overall, great to have a date night for special occasions.

Been coming here for a few months now and the crab cake is insanely amazing! The Wagyu steak is worth every penny and I get it on special occasions - Definitely a place you need to try. I also get a cucumber and avocado roll every time I come and even though it's not on the menu, they always come through! 10/10
No comment
No comment

This place is awesome! Started off with the shishito peppers and it was good. The filet mignon was out of this world! It was cooked to perfection and seasoned very nicely, I also liked that it comes with herb butter on top and some sides to dip. We also ordered the cheese fries and wow it's a large portion but so good! The fries are definitely good for sharing. I would definitely recommend to spot by for dinner and drinks!
No comment
No comment
It's been a minute but we came in for a birthday. My favorite dish was the uni steak. We ordered 3 orders more after the first. It was that good.

We got the porterhouse for two, large baked onion and broccoli and it was all delicious! The streak had a perfect crust and the meat just melted in your mouth. There was an issue with the pilot light so our order took longer than expected. Without us saying anything they paid for one round of drinks for the inconvenience. The vibe was relaxed and warm--classy casual. I would absolutely go back!

This place did not disappoint. Â For drinks, I had the salt + charcoal margarita and their take on a mojito. Â While both were great, I preferred the margarita. Â For appetizers, I had the best salmon roll, I've ever had! The steak tartare was interesting as it was mixed with a sweet sauce. Â Then I had the porterhouse and cheese fries. Â Needless to say, I was stuffed at the end of dinner but was extremely satisfied with everything. Oh yeah, and the service was great.
No comment

Beautifully presented dishes and great service staff. Our table had a server and assistant server. The host showed us to our table which was ready on time. We had a birthday cake and it was stored nicely until the end of our meal. The best dishes were the cheese fries, porter house with lobster, and crab cake. Note that Salt and Charcoal is an upscale Japanese steakhouse. There was wasabi in many of the dishes and I do not like wasabi. If you do, you will enjoy their dishes with wasabi sauces. The wagyu was not great, unfortunately too dry, and I thought as a Japanese steakhouse and for $225 it would be perfected.
No comment
The oysters and lamb were excellent. Â Also really great filet mignon. Highly recommended.

Awesome spot for aged steak! It was cooked perfectly everytime I get it and I've been there a lot. Do yourself a favor and get the edamame and the porterhouse (mid rare) and skip the grilled vegetables/broccoli and baked onion (unless you enjoy mushy vegetables then don't let me stop you)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
That wagyu steak was absolutely amazing!!! The seasonal veggies really complimented them.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

Nice to try something new, environment is good. But service is okay, the steak took too long and there was a gap of 40 minutes between when we finished the appetizers and when the steak got to our table.
No comment
The food and service was absolutely amazing. I will definitely be returning to this venue.
No comment
No comment
incredible food, service, and experience. Would definitely go back again to try other dishes :)
Besides the steak (please have it rare or medium-rare), the cheese fries and the matcha cake are always A+++
No comment
No comment
Best steak I've had in a long time. Great menu great food good drinks & excellent service. I was able to make a same day reservation and accommodate my my family for a birthday celebration.
Excellent food & service--looking forward to returning. Â Had an excellent ribeye, fried oysters, and salads.

Interesting cocktails, delicious food, interesting fusion of styles, cozy atmosphere. Nice spot for a date, atmosphere may not be ideal for large groups. Wait staff was attentive and explained the dishes while serving them.
Food never disappoints. The porterhouse and the uni filet are 2 of my favorites and go to dishes every time I come here!
The spot is banging. Porterhouse was fire. Wagyu rolls were good too. Everything was cooked to perfection. Highly recommend
Went here on a Monday night & it was great. Very attentive staff & delicious food! Highly recommend making a reservation!
No comment
No comment
Excellent is only a word. Spectacular food and service. Get there if you can. It's worth the visit.

love all the menu options they have here, and service and drinks are all very delicious. wagyu prices are very fair for the quality and they're prepared deliciously. I've been twice and tried almost everything. My favorite item is the filet mignon and the wagyu steak with their fries. I also enjoyed their crab cake. However, be prepared to wait a long time for the mains/steaks to come out. Probably took about 30 min each time for the mains to come out.
No comment
So good! Romantic downstairs area. Knowledgeable waiters. Wonderful area to hang out before or after.
The food was amazing!!! Also a very nice and intimate setting. I had the tuna tartare and lamb chops both tasted amazing

Definitely, a treat yourself place because of the price. Total I think was $130 (excluding tip) for tuna tartare, NY steak, miso soup, and veggies. Giving it 1 star less because the steak took 1 hour and 45 mins to arrive at the table. I understand staffing shortages but to keep it brief - I had a pretty rough flight coming to the city and I took a nap at the table and my steak still didn't arrive lol.
No comment
Their dry aged 30 Day Jyukusei New York Strip Steak was absolutely phenomenal. Didn't need the sauces it came with but was good with them too. Cannot rate this high enough. Great date spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The seaweed salad stole the show ! Crab cake was good. Personally recommend using all three components on the dish together to get the unique flavor it offers. That would be the micro sprout salad, crab cake, and wasabi sauce all in one bite. The fish was good. It comes with herb butter, ponzu sauce, and we were served an orange slice to compliment the dish...Japanese style, I guess.
No comment

Overall a great meal and great service. Steaks are dry aged in house. They are busrting with flavor and super tender. Things I think they can improve on is seasoning. Everything was just slightly under seasoned from the steak to the herb butter. The roasted potatoes was topped with a bit to much herb butter. The Waygu Tartare lacked any flavor. I've never had Japanese Waygu but I understand it to not have a intense beef flavor however the tartare was bland. The perfectly aged steaks made up for the slight misses

Came here on a Saturday night and sat outdoors. Very cozy and warm despite the chill outside and there was an option to turn on the heater we had next to us but we didn't need it. We started off with three appetizers, the wagyu uni, shishito peppers and the crab cake. Out of all three, we loved the crab cake the most! Would definitely order that again. We had the 30 day Porterhouse for two and it was cooked just right, Medium Rare. The herb butter it came with was delicious as well as the side sauces.

Cool place with tasty food. The wait staff was really nice. The food menu is small, so if you're looking for many options do not come here. The porterhouse steak for two was delicious. The cheese fries are good. The baked potato was a little messy, but the flavor was nice. I believe they used a wasabi butter on it. I think the drinks were sake based because they weren't strong at all. The miso sauce for the crunch oyster was also very tasty.
Excellent service, wonderful food and great ambiance. Definitely one of Brooklyn's most unique and creative spots. Will definitely return.
No comment

One of my favorite spot! The vibe is so relaxing and chill. The staff there are Amazing and very friendly. They even came to us and offer free dessert because our fries came little late. I was very surprised how generous and sweet they are! I definitely recommend their ny steak crunchy oyster cheese fries and also uni waygu beef was all very delicious. I also really move that wasabi creamy sauce! It is definitely a place to try and come back again!

Came here for my anniversary and the food was so delicious... here's what we got! The crab cake paired well with sauce and I wasn't able to take photos of the other items we ordered but we also ordered wagyu then for desert we ordered a splendid matcha lava cake.
Overall would say a bit pricey for what they serve! Didn't try the steak so can't say anything about that since it is a steakhouse. Service was really good and the atmosphere is great.
No comment
Terrible service manger came and yelled at us, because even didn't tip enough even though the service was terrible. Never going here again. Rude management plus they charged me twice on my card.

100% recommended. The steak is simply seasoned with salt and pepper and it's just simply delicious. Or maybe just salt only. Cocktails are also amazing. 10/10 on the indoor dining atmosphere. Big shoutout to the cook who cooked my uni fillet mignon, had a party going on in my mouth.

Food Â was good but I'll never come again ....we ordered 2 sushi rolls the $250 wagu and a onion shitio peppers and found out at the end the octopus wasn't avilable .... Food wasn't the problem the problem was it took 2.5 hours ...... we basically waited 1 hour for each sushi roll to come out ..... worst place to go for a date night esp if your hungry spend your money somewhere else

Great date spot! Loved the ambience, the food was amazing, and the service was good. It was obvious that our server was new but was adorable and attentive. It's pricy but honestly worth it. The filet mignon melts in your mouth and the sushi was really good.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food qualitatively speaking was so so. The porterhouse for 2 was fatty and not the choicest cut. The salad wedge was tasty. The salmon sushi roll did not taste to be the freshest. Â The green tea matcha cake with vanilla ice cream was the best of everything served along with the green tea. Only 3 desserts listed on menu. The matcha became a bit cloying by the third bite though. Hip Williamsburg vibe. No one over 40 here. All getting a jump start to clogged arteries. Service was attentive but nothing Â special. Â Nice big square ice cube in my Manhattan cocktail, Â which helped my drink taste good. All this mediocrity doesn't come cheap. Â About $300 for everything.

First of all, this restaurant definitely not $$, they should correct it to $$$ restaurant. Appetizers was pretty good. Just the porter house size is smaller than what we expect. One side is sirloin, the other side is filet mignon, it was pretty disappointed that the sirloin side have 1/3 of tendon. Other than that.. the flavor was good tho.

Amazing food and our waiter was great. Host not so great and felt like giving me a hard time about a reservation they cancelled! But other than that it was amazing and our waiter was extremely knowledgeable everything we were eating and drinking!
No comment

Over 2 years later, and Salt + Charcoal continues to impress! During my 5th time here for dinner, we ordered the usual porterhouse, side baked potatoes, side organic grilled veggies, two glasses of red wine, and the matcha cake and a Manhattan to end the delicious meal. The service is still great, quality of food is phenomenal, and we still think Salt + Charcoal is underrated. We love that it's low key, chill, and cozy - the atmosphere brings us back whether it's a hot summer day or a winter snowy evening. And the flavors... I mean, wasabi cream + yuzu on steak... heaven! Go here. You won't regret it! And you'll likely prefer it over Peter Luger and other famous NYC steakhouses.
No comment
Great eats and ambiance. East enjoyed the both the filet mignon and lamb chops cooked to desired perfection
Uni and steak! Pricey but melts like butter. Recommend eating with more than one other person!
No comment
Great cocktails , amazing food. I went there with a few friends , I was surprised they have a vine room in the basement. We had a few a5waguy appetizers , they were off the hook .
Go for the A5 Japanese wagyu - totally worth it. Also the oysters are great. The waiter told us the filet would be the best being from his hometown, and he wasn't wrong.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food and sake were good, but extremely expensive for small portions. The uni piece was miniature. Also, one woman who worked there was very rude. My friend and I actually felt unwelcome. Everyone else there was fine though. I wouldn't go back unfortunately.
Amazing steak. Great vibe. Host was a bit frosty but I sat at the bar and felt right at home.

Great food, good drinks, mostly good service. The shrimp crunch sushi was very good! The cocktails were pretty good but not amazing. The outdoor tables have a lot of ants but I suppose that's not their fault, and indoor tables were very hot and stuffy.

A little bit loud and may be better for groups than for a 1 on 1 situation. I don't like sushi, but I shared a sushi order and thought it was pretty good. Prices were mostly reasonable and what I would expect for a steakhouse. Will probably pick up the cheese fries again to go.
No comment

We went to the place with a dinner time reservation, had appetizer in about half an hour, and waited for almost three hours for the entrÃ©e that NEVER came out. Â So we walked out of the place cold and starving. Â The staff members kept telling us the food is about to come for two hours, and we finally got to know that the grill was shut off. Â I understand this could happen, however, the staff should have told us earlier, instead of keeping the expectation there. Â We wasted few hours and left the place so late at night that other restaurants nearby are all closed. Â We saw other posts about the long wait issue and the restaurant should really address that. Â Price is also way more expensive than two $ signs.
Wow!? The flavors deliver. I'm pleasantly pleased with the Japanese flair. The sushi options and the beef cuts deliver. This imconcept is done very well.

So good. Porterhouse cooked medium was just the way we like it. Cheese fries were INSANE but very good. Just would suggests ordering them if party is larger than two as we had a hard times digging through them. And the baked potato I HIGHLY recommend. Service was the best part, however.
No comment
Ioved this place! The steak and uni was my favorite. All the apps was good. definitely coming back. After eating all that meat, my sister and I still craved it the next day.
No comment

While the food here was delicious it was completely overshadowed by the face that the total meal experience took 2 and a half hours. When you eat at a more expensive place like this you expect service and the experience to be good. Â From the time we got our appetizers to the time we got our dinner it was well over an hour. The funny part was our steaks were warm but the duck and lamb chops were ice cold. I would have loved this place if I didn't end up eating so late and was so frustrated by deals with really no legitimate reason. Not sure if I will ever be back because of it.

Literally just salt and charcoal. Food was extremely bland and flavorless. I was referee by a coworker and went lay minute. Turned out to be a huge disappointment. Service was great. I could have did without having to keep swatting away the drain flies. Lobster had zero seasoning, I didn't even taste butter. Even Waygu was disappointing which I never thought possible. The staff was great but for me it was a big waste.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

They had a tremendous amount of outdoor dining space! I honestly think the space outside is more spacious then the inside space! The waiters were very polite and helpful. They definitely were trying to sell us on drinks as much as possible. We chose to sit next to the curb - but many of the seats were very distanced which was very nice. They had a good blend of american food like steaks and duck and a good amount of sushi and sashimi. I got the sashimi and my friend got the duck. Both were equally delicious. I saw that the sushi that other tables got were HUGE. The japanese food comes with freshly grated wasabi and they had very nice complimentary mixes of sauces.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

It was full of disappoint! The service was horrible and slow at the restaurant. We order the uni filet mignon and it Â came out out Medium well when we order medium rare.. I spoke to the server and they didn't do anything about it.. I never been to a restaurant that ever did that to me before. I would not come back here

By far one of the best meals I have had in a very long time! I shared with a friend and we split the Salmon and the 8oz filet wowowowowow!!! The all day baked onion amazing! Tuna tartare RIDICULOUS! It's not cheap but totally worth it
No comment

I came here on a date, and hands down, we agreed that this is one of the best restaurants we went during our "first date week." The drinks were Â worth the price because of the presentation alone, but they're also well made. The presentation for the food displayed that the chef truly know what it meant to eat with your eyes first. Everything from the cheese fries and broccoli to the expensive (but worth every dollar) steak made our mouths water. We will be coming back and will be bringing friends and family to have the same great dining experience that we had.
No comment

This place has been on my list of spots to try for quite a while now. I love and appreciate a good Japanese steakhouse and sushi! My friend and I shared the New York strip steak and it was cooked to perfection (medium rare). My friend has celiac (gluten-free) and they were extremely accommodating with this in putting all the sauces on the side, omitting the tempura flakes on our sushi roll (albacore roll-- not pictured because it was so good we ate it too fast to take one) and even had gluten free soy sauce for her. The wagyu, uni roll was amazing as well. It was like a build your own hand roll and the flavors of the the two items together was just spectacular! Our server was phenomenal and we will definitely be returning! Thank you Salt + Charcoal!
No comment
No comment

Delicious dinner. We had the seaweed salad, 30 days aged porterhouse and a half order of the cheese fries. The salad was refreshing with 4 types of seaweed. The steak was tender and loved it with the yuzu sauce. It comes with watercress with I loved! The cheese fries was seasoned perfectly and gave me just enough carbs.

It's alright I guess but for $400 meal much better options elsewhere that doesn't make you wait two hours for a rather simple porterhouse steak to come out. Perhaps they were understaffed but not even a word? Sushi is actually very good Â for a steakhouse but also took an hour half to come out. Service needs attention.
Ok but we waited way to long for our food . It was ok but definitely do not plan on going back
No comment
No comment
No comment
Drove all the way to Brooklyn to try this spot. Says open to midnight, but when we arrived at 10:30 we were turned away & told that the kitchen was closed. Super disappointing!

The Food is Beyond Amazing!!! Its worth all the Hype!! Small place so reservations is a must! I can't recommend anything specific because we ordered Everything and I dunno what I loved more .... omg and the Salt & Charcoal drink is the unicorn of all cocktails with the black salt soooooo Delicious
No comment
No comment

I put the steaks up there with the best. I have been coming here here over 10 years and they rarely have an off night. The porter house is up there if not better than Â Peter Lugar. Sushi is also great and side of veggies. They have a great saki list and cocktails are well made. Cant wait to come back !
No comment
No comment
No comment

First time in this hip restaurant. It is a true wow! I was first greeted by Shayna who walked me to my table outside. I ordered the Tuna tartar and the dry aged NY steak. It was all absolutely Â amazing. The steak is the best I have had in NY, that says a lot. With the herb butter topping i took a long time to enjoy every bite. After dinner I sat at the bar and drank a Japanese whisky version of an old fashion. The best ever! The bartender seemed to take great care to extract the best flavors from the fresh ingredients, with a big cube of ice I also enjoyed every sip. I will be back. If your are a local, or a traveler, this is a do not miss on the restaurant list.

The prices do not match the quality; if you are serving imitation crab have imitation crab prices. The only saving grace of this place is the branzino and cocktails (the crab cake use to be decent as well, try your luck maybe it still is). Overall there are far better options anywhere near by actually worth the price tag.
No comment

One of the best steakhouses I have ever been to. The flavor profile and marbleization is pronounced in every single bite. I am not a steak eater but my husband is. We were head over heels for this place and will go back soon. We love you can watch them cook with the clear through window in the main dining area. Will be back soon.
No comment
No comment
This is a local gem. Their steaks and sauces never disappoint (and neither did the French fries).
No comment

INCREDIBLE! Delicious crab cakes, sushi, and filet. Cannot recommend Salt + Charcoal enough! We ordered a number of dishes to share amongst 4 people, and loved each dish! Great social distancing precautions in place.
Out of the $600 bill the tastiest thing was the $9.00 bottle of water.... From the Cheese fries to the Filet Mignon, nothing was done right.
No comment

Stopped by here last minute without making reservations and we were lucky enough to get an indoor table right away because someone else didn't show up! We started off with the wagyu sushi, and also got the shrimp crunch, and the 36oz porterhouse steak. The wagyu sushi was okay, we didn't like it but that may just be us because we're not used to eating raw meat. The shrimp crunch was SO good, definitely recommend it. It was fresh, spicy, crunchy, simply delicious. Now the porterhouse, phenomenal. It came out sizzling hot, perfectly juicy and well seasoned. The lemon butter on it was so tasty. Lastly for dessert we got the matcha cake. One of my favorites as well. It was creamy with the perfect matcha flavor that wasn't too little or too much. It went beautifully with the vanilla ice cream. Their pineapple cocktail is also really really good, highly recommend. Staff was so friendly and attentive, service was great. Can't wait to go back, it was a lovely experience.

Server was great. Food was good. The wagyu steak was amazing. The tuna tartare was okay tho, it was served differently than I'm used too and didn't taste that good. The spot is definitely worth the expensive , especially for that wagyu.
No comment
No comment

I'm so excited to have found this place thanks to Yelp! We dined in on a Tuesday evening and we were seated right away. The place is small but I liked that as it made the dining experience intimate and cozy. We didn't order any appetizers apart from drinks. The shiso mojito and the salt/charcoal drinks were sweet, strong and refreshing. We ordered the duck entree as well as the New York strip which came with a lemon butter sauce. Although I enjoyed the steak, I don't think it needed the butter but nonetheless the steak was soo tender, juicy and it hit the spot. The duck was also super tasty and the potatoes it came with complimented it well. Everything just tasted like it was made with care and of quality ingredients and the prices were more than reasonable. See you soon!

Don't get me wrong, the food can be good here but the service is truly appalling. This has been my second time here, once during the first year opened and second time was the other week. First time I remembered the service could've been better and was very meh, second time was flat out terrible. Reservations were at 9 but we didn't get seated until 9:15. Once they seated us, you would think they cared to ATLEAST ask if we want some water for the table right away like ANY normal place would normally do. But no, we sat there for exactly a whole 30 minutes with no one checking in on us one bit let alone having water on the table!! After the half hour, we had to get up and look for our waiter for his attention in which he replied in such a rude manner!! Yet he still did not service us right away after we had to come up to him. 45 minutes later, and he finally came to take our order!!! RIDICULOUS, with no genuine sincere apology. We were absolutely starving at that rate so we even ordered 2-3 cocktails with him right away knowing that their service would be slow all night just from that start as well as all of our food. Told them it doesn't have to wait for it all to be ready to come to our table or which order whether if entree or appetizer came first... to just fire it all up since we were just so hungry at that rate. But no, the food took awhile to come, and it all just came together. It was so hard to even enjoy the food after being so upset. I remember the first time I ate here I really enjoyed the filet mignon with uni however, the beef and tuna tartares as well as some other dish that is not on the menu this time. Never again will I come here
No comment
No comment

Really great dine in experience. Very attentive service. I had a bottle of sake and beer with my meal. Tuna tartare was on point, love the fact that you make your own hand rolls. They have a great selection of steak and it could get pricey, but even their least expensive option the New York Strip was delicious and filling for 2 (the charred fatty pieces are the best part ;)) I ordered some Uni, which is the best I've ever tasted (not a big uni person because it's an acquired taste, and I finally acquired it after eating here (not too salty or slimey & tasted great with the steak)). Also had the cheese fries which were delicious.

My partner and I were looking forwards to trying out the Filet Mignon with Uni, but alas, they were out of uni by 8p.m. Â Really a shame since that was the only reason I had picked this place to go to. We then opted for the 14oz strip steak since we were already here, but it was at best, average. While we thought it was moderately tender and had some flavor, it didn't really stand out. My partner thought the soy lemon onion sauce was the saving grace for it. Â Maybe it was the lingering disappointment, but we didn't exactly enjoy ourselves here.

Hip spot in Brooklyn offering outdoor dining during Covid. If uni and steak are your jam, then Salt & Charcoal is a must. The cocktails also go great with this uni steak overload. The oysters are huge and are a must get. The uni wagyu is amazing as well. I will be back for more.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I took my boyfriend to Salt + Charcoal for his birthday. We were seated outside, and although it didn't have the cutest decor, the service and food made up for it. Our waitress was really attentive and sweet but our meal felt a little rushed, possibly due to it being a busy night? Unsure but they were coming to grab our plates pretty quickly even when we weren't finished. For an expensive dinner like this one, I would've expected to be able to savor my meal. Anyway, on to the food! We started with the truffle chawanmushi which was light but flavorful. We also had the fried oysters which I thought were so juicy! I saw people raving about the wagyu tartare so we got that but I would probably skip this next time. The wagyu was unfortunately overpowered by the noodles it came with. The wagyu uni sushi would've probably been a better choice. My absolute favorite was the uni filet mignon - worth the splurge! They are generous with the uni and it is definitely enough to share for two. Being the child I am, I also ordered the cheese fries which were thin and crispy just the way I like them. Great place to celebrate a special occasion!
No comment
This food was amazing. Their grilled veggies are on point. Their sides are on point. The steak was delicious and that charcoal edemame!! Woah. Loved the food and the vibe!

Food was not bad but definitely not worth it for the price! 3 appetizers, 3 entrees, and 2 drinks and the total was $750 Â I get high quality food and restaurants but the restaurant had more of a super relaxed and laid back vibe and the food definitely did not match the price. Customer service was fine, but for that price I would definitely not come back and go to another place
If you are craving both Japanese and a good steak, this is the place to be! Super fresh, quality fish for their sashimi box and steaks are always cooked to perfection.
No comment
No comment

Went to Salt + Charcoal about 2 years ago and again recently with friends and both times have been just amazing. A cozy intimate restaurant in Williamsburg that brings a lot of flavor and quality food. Their charcoal grilled edamame and cheese fries are great! All the sushi was very fresh and the 30 day dry aged porterhouse was perfect. I loved the uni wagyu roll and tuna tartare (which is freshly made at the table). The Japanese Prime Wagyu is literally perfection if you really want to splurge. Highly recommend Salt + Charcoal!

Great streak grilled to perfection. Ordered New York strip steak, it was . It was 14 oz, but I can finish it all! The sauce is not a highlight actually, it didn't add much more flavor to the steak Â as I think.

We used to love Salt + Charcoal but the service has become terrible. We placed a pickup order on a Tuesday evening recently, and the estimated pickup kept increasing. Eventually, the estimated pickup climbed to 10:30 pm - more than an hour later than originally estimated. We kept trying to call the restaurant to find out what was going on and being put on hold for 5+ minutes with no one ever coming back onto the phone to talk to us. We finally just went to the restaurant in person because we were starving and had no idea what was going on. The guy at the counter didn't seem to care that it had now been over an hour since we placed our pickup order and told us to just cancel it because it would be a "very very long time" before it was ready. Â He also refused to seat us so we could just eat there in person, despite the restaurant being mostly empty. We had to cancel the order on DoorDash and then waste more time contacting DoorDash to get a refund processed because Salt + Charcoal wouldn't do anything on their end to communicate that the cancellation was not our fault. I tried to reach out to the restaurant about this by email afterwards and never received a reply. I love the food here, but Salt + Charcoal clearly doesn't care about service so we unfortunately won't be coming back.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Customer service was amazing Â made a reservation and was seated on time. Small restaurant but very comfortable seating. Food was also delicious, the hamachi melts in your mouth. Writing this review makes me want to go back now
I've been at salt and charcoal a few times now and food and service is always impeccable. I definitely recommend their aged steaks and assortment of sashimi
No comment

I enjoyed my meal there, love the crab cake, the sauce is wonderful. The steak is very balanced. Only one thing I don't like is being sent to their cellar level. Some ppl might like it, but I would prefer to go to the first floor next time.
No comment
We got there late and they were able to accommodate us fully! Tee was incredible and helped us so much! Definitely coming back!

This was my second time dining at Salt + Charcoal and I'm even more impressed the second time. I had the pleasure of celebrating my 25th birthday here 2 years ago and it was superb. From the Baked Potatoes to the various dipping sauces. And the Porterhouse; one of the best steaks in my life. Cooked to absolute perfection. The first time I visited it was 48 Day aged, and the latter time only 30. No matter, it was just as tender and flavorful as the first time. The customer service is always A1. We wanted to try something a little different after having a lot of hard liquor before we arrived so our waiter recommended we try S+C's signature cocktails which were perfect. Aside from the food and drinks, S+C is one of those smaller niche spots, which is perfect for me and my friends, but don't expect to have a huge dinner here. It's tailored to smaller groups looking for a more intimate setting. The outside seating reminds me of one of those Little Italy mafia hangouts, minus the tacky tablecloths. I mention this spot to anyone I know who enjoys a good steak. A must-have in Williamsburg. I'll be back soon.

This place will honestly make you commit all kind of savory sins... I mean if your salivary glands are working properly, you're in trouble coming here. Â I went here on a date with my boyfriend and got carried away literally (and physically :-p) my taste buds were wowed with every bite! From the appetizer down to the entree even the still fancy WATER, YES THE $9 bottle water of Saratoga! It was awesome and so fresh, everything! I looked at the menu and reviews prior to going and I still wasn't ready for the amazement I was about to encounter. For the appetizer we ordered the Salt + Charcoal Crab Cake, it was too divine. It honestly can be a mini meal, it was shared sized portion to tenderize your palate for everything that was about to come. It was delectable even with the garnish salad and wasabi cream sauce on which it was plated. Everything went really well together! For the entree, we did the shared 50 day Jyukusei Porterhouse Steak Steak for two. For sides, cheese fries, grilled broccoli and baked potatoes. Now it was massive! It was definitely a portion made for 2 (or more-they also have for 3 the steak portion). The steak was prepared upon request as medium well. AND WELL IT WAS! Honestly, it was melt in your mouth steak. Not much chewing required. Â Just typing this review all over again I want to revisit. The cheese fries I'd say I can skip for the next time because the cheese got cold and wasn't as enjoyable because we were so focused on the other foods we forgot about that mundane order lol. The cheese fries were good but the steak, those sauces and those potatoes was the star of the night! I was stuffed after that meal! There was no way you wouldn't be stuffed. I want to be stuffed some more so some way some how I will be finding my way back to this steakhouse!

We started off with some lychee martinis, grilled octopus and edamame, which Kiome said was cooked with some secret oil. Both were delicious! The octopus was flavorful and we were given two large tentacles, and the edamame wasn't just all talk. The secret oil was in fact delightful. We shared the 14oz 50 day aged NY Strip. The steak itself was amazing. We got the grilled veggies (apparently from finger lakes), which honestly we probably could've done without (16$ for grilled veggies seems a little steep). Overall excellent food and presentation. Service was great, I would come back to try to wagyu.
