No comment

This place was great! We had someone with a gluten intolerance and they cooked some amazing chicken and rice. We appreciate that our server helped and went over the top to make sure everyone had a great meal not just a bowl of rice. Thank you
No comment

Came for brunch. Ordered Wagyu Supreme and Today's Salt + Charcoal brunch (first one on the menu). Both dishes were flavorful that we would definitely come back to try their dinner menu. Service needs to be improved however.

My new favorite Japanese Restaurant!! I'm very picky when it comes to Japanese food since I grew up in Tokyo, but this restaurant is hands down the best Japanese restaurant I discovered in a while. Very fresh Sashimi, amazing robata veggies and meat, great sake, cocktails and super yummy desert. Black cod Saikyo Miso Yaki is to die for! I almost never go outside of the city just to have dinner, but I'm definitely going back there sometime soon. Amazing!!
No comment

So delicious!!! We loved the gyoza dumpling wings, the cod, and the waygu beef - so tender! From the cocktails to the food, our server was friendly and knowledgeable. The robataya grill is such a rare and tasty find in New York. I loved looking into the open kitchen and watching the expert staff prepare everything. Can't wait to return! Arigato, Salt + Charcoal!
Great place. Keep the hard work, everything taste amazing.. Thx you for this great night. Can't wait for the restaurant to get drinks to come back.

The meal I had here was truly something special. Service was a bit slow on a busy Friday night but with such a lovely atmosphere and meal I really didn't mind. Ordering tip--be adventurous and you will be rewarded!

Sat at the bar and waited over an hour for anything to come out of the kitchen ( including a salad) asked repeatedly where the food was but the bar tender seemed too busy to be bothered and had no one backing him up. Finally we had to leave with only one dish of five making it to us. To add insult to injury they handed me a bill which I handed right back to the manager and explained why i wouldn't be paying it. They are a management / staff nightmare, as for the food... Guess I'll never know.

Good Japanese food! The drinks are very tasty as well. Very friendly staff. The restaurant is clean and you can see the cooks cook your meal through a glass window which is great. Great addition to the neighborhood!

I've never tried something at Salt and Charcoal that I didn't like. Any dish with their Wagyu beef is excellent. The Umami Chicken Wings and Shrimp Crunch Roll are my favorite. And even if you're "not a dessert person" you should try the Waffle Mochi Ice Cream. You won't regret it. While the wait staff is a little... eager, the quaint space is laid out well, with an open kitchen where you can see how robata-style cooking works.

This was my second round at this restaurant and it was well worth it. My first experience was so so but the staff and food quality truly shined the second time around. My specialist (waiter) Johnathan had some true knowledge about the menu and drink pairings for each dish he recommended. I even worked up the courage to try a damn sea urchin. Their twist on the urchin is flavorful and honestly worth a try. The octopus and steak was cooked perfectly over the Japanese charcoals but it's how the subtle ingredients are used with one another that make each dish standout. Here's the thing, I've eaten at many restaurants (high end + low end) and usually leave feeling a little robbed at times either by the quality of food or service. The people here care about the experience provided. I saw the chef watching me with anticipation and confidence from the corner of my eye as I took the first few bites of the steak he prepared. Open kitchen by the way so you get to see how clean things are at this place. I hate dirty kitchens. Hoping my next visit is just as memorable.

In one word: excellent. The food is superb. The ambiance is warm and inviting; very cool, very fun. The waitstaff is knowledgeable and down-to-earth. The beverage selection is intelligently compiled with great cocktails and fantastic sake. Prices are more than reasonable, especially given the high quality of food. I read some of the other reviews and did not find the same experience as those who wrote negatively. There are great deals here, like the Wagyu Roll for $15 (Wagyu!) and 5 appetizers in The Daily Starter for just $12. I highly recommend Salt+Charcoal and look forward to my next culinary adventure there.

great food and service. I had the wagyu mushi shabu (just great) and the kale tofu salad and friends had other menu items, Â The food was fresh and full of flavor. They had Ice cream for desert (awsome) and I had the Shratama Â cream for desert, Â just excellent!

The food is awesome and the staff are rad. Wagyu beef dishes melt in your mouth... Get the salmon that's encrusted in salt, it's crazy good. Drink oolong-hai's they make you feel good. I come to this place at least once a week for my fix :)

Maybe it was an off night, but my friend and I were really disappointed with the food. Â The edamame was burnt and flavorless and the mushroom appetizer was just boring. Â I wasn't wowed by this place and I definitely will not be going back.

Was excited to try this restaurant after hearing good reviews. Â  Still sitting here after 2 hours waiting for some of our food to arrive. Â  Portions that have come to our table are very small and not inexpensive. Â I will not visit this restaurant again.

I ordered eggs and Canadian bacon for brunch - when it came the bacon was actually pork belly - and VERY fatty pork belly at that (i looked it up online when i got home and it was clearly not Canadian bacon) - and the eggs were so salty I didn't eat them. The rolls were nice and the miso soup was ok. Our server was cool and nice and I left her a proper tip as it was not her fault that the food was poor. In our party of 5, three people were pleased with their meals, one was just ok and mine was a write off.

Love everything about his restaurant. Must admit it's on the pricey side but food was great. We got the tuna tartar and wagyu tartar and WOW blown away. We also got the NY strip and it was very soft and cooked well. The ambiance of this place was also great and had a lot of cool bars and dessert places for afterwards.
No comment

I am so impressed with this place. I would recommend it to any food lover. The sushi rolls were some of the best I've ever had. They make a beautiful salmon roll that is a million times better than any rainbow roll you've ever had --that's actually what I was craving. This place exceeded my expectations by miles. The NY strip was perfect. The sashimi so fresh and delicious. Great wine selection. Cozy atmosphere, candle lit. Great for date night. Great service. Highest recommendations!

I had dinner lasy night w a friend we both had the $60 omakase it was good, some of it excellent but the order of the plates should be different, me and my friend work in the industry he is a executive chef and im an agm, our server was attentive and knowledgeable but he was hiding for a bit and i dont blame him since we waited a very long time for our food, at the end they gave us a complementary carafe of sake which was nice, i really want to give this place another chance and i will be back.

My boyfriend and I came here and had amazing food. Our server was so knowledgeable. It's worth asking the server questions to learn about the cooking style and the type of food to expect. It's definitely a small plates style restaurant, but the portions were actually quite big compared to other small plates experiences we've had (especially in Manhattan!). I wouldn't say it's inexpensive, but you absolutely get what you pay for - great food. We had several small plates and a few cocktails each and with a 20% tip we still were under $200 for the night. We are already thinking about when to go back!

Contrary to many reviews, on a Friday night around 8:45 we had no issues with long waits for food - everything came out at a reasonable time. Service was friendly and able to answer our questions. We tried the cocktails - pretty good, the Yuzu Mule was a bit sweet but flavorful. The food overall was very tasty - especially the Ebi shrimp toast appetizer, so good! We had the Wagyu beef and Black Cod for entrees- while both were delicious as other reviews mentioned the portions were terribly small. $28 for the cod which was probably only 4 Oz. and some Quinoa on the side felt like a rip off. I would come back for an appetizer or the sushi but it's just too expensive for such small portions to come back regularly.

I guess I should have listened to the negative reviews. Portions were small and lacked flavor. The skewers were nothing special. Wagyu was delicious but it's Wagyu so it better be. Warm tofu was good too. Waiters were friendly but lacked knowledge of the menu. Prices were high relative to how unremarkable the food was. We tried it so now I can say I tried it and don't need to go back.
No comment
No comment

We had the porterhouse steak and it is really good but too big for 2 persons. And we felt stuffed and a little bit sick when we finished it.. If they offer smaller size like around 20oz, that would be perfect.

Loved it. Not in Williamsburg that much, but went with a local who lives close by. Â She had not been there either. Inventive, fresh, Japanese cuisine. Not a sushi place per se, but has sushi offerings. We had smoked mackerel, sliced, on sliced daikon radish. Also al dente udon with minced pork in a delicious flavorful broth, unagi rock, a terrific platter of eel sushi and duck breast, each thinly sliced piece was wrapped with radish and carrot. Â They have a full bar and service was great, I/we'll be back.

Came despite recent mediocre reviews. Â Most of the recent complaints by others are accurate. Â  Food was decent but service was weak. Â They definitely need more people working there. Â Otherwise there are enough places in the city with similar food.

Tasty, but like some other reviewers said-small amounts of food for large amounts of money. I will be back accompanied by someone with an expense account. Comfy chairs at the grill bar, fun to watch the chefs at work
No comment
Great place ... Â Food is amazing and drinks are great .. Very Brooklyn !!!! Â  I'll make this a 5 star once I get more food for the money .... Small plates :.(. But till :.)
It's like your summer BBQ, but everything is cooked to perfection.

This place is pretty great! They have a really interesting menu. We ordered a wide variety of food and everything was very good. Ambiance is good, though a little bit loud and cramped. Service was great. Looking forward to going back!

I asked the waitress what I should order and she recommended two market price items. They were okay - waygu beef and sashimi salmon. The beef ended up being $50 for a small plate. Absolutely livid. I wanted the $18 pork and rice and she directed me to the overpriced and waygu. I wasn't pleased with the food but more importantly I spent $80 on small plates and am ordering food on the way home. Avoid.
Great place to eat, chill catch up with friends. This place is an a awesome part of the city. The food is outstanding, that is what Keeps me coming back for more. Love the food!!!!

We wanted to like this place, great location cool interior and a nice menu. Â We went here for dinner and saw that there were entrees and small bites. Â My girlfriend and I each chose a entree but wanted to make sure we had enough food. Â The waitress suggested we add one of the small bites to our meal Â she was very helpful. Â Once we got our food things were promising, we got the small bites chicken which ended up being this huge portion. Â It was hot a crispy and very good. Â Then my girlfriend's shrimp tempora can out and after searching through the plate there were no shrimp. Â The waitress confirmed and got shrimp cooked as fast as possible. It was ok when it arrived and the vegetable s we 're not crispy. Â I got the pork belly over potatoes and the size of the plate made me feel like Andre the giant. There were two triscuit size pieces of pork belly and a tiny baby sized mound of potatoes. Â Both were amazingly flavorful and would love to have again but for an entree price we got a appetizer size plate. I even thought maybe I ordered off the wrong Â section but I didn't. Â If it was full sized I would say def get it but the portion was out of whack. Â If we had not gotten the extra chicken we would have went home needling more food. Â The flavors are all here and the food is pretty good but the portion size and pricing knock it down. Will consider trying again if these improve

This place is seriously awesome, I can't believe the bad reviews. My boyfriend and I live nearby so we came in last week for some dinner. Everything was great, from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. We loved sitting at at the kitchen counter where you get to watch the chefs cook robata on the charcoal grill. Our server was really sweet and helped us pick a great sake. Favorite dishes were the salmon sushi roll, the seaweed salad, the kenchin soba, and the nasu eggplant. Oh and the matcha chocolate cake was my dream dessert. I definitely wanna come back to try the robata skewers next time!

This place should get higher stars but the service was terrible. We dined early on a Friday evening. The waiter and staff kept wanting to take our plates asking 'if we were done' Â  Â The restaurant started to get a bit full but still wasn't crowded yet. We felt rushed the whole time. The food was just okay, the sake presentation was good and the downstairs bathroom was nice. There are too many options in the hood that I will not settle for bad service.

Uni Shooter appetizer is A MUST! A truly excellent restaurant in Williamsburg. The setting and decor are a bit intimate so I recommend it for dates or smaller groups. The food is delicious but I must give 4 rather than 5 stars because I don't think the prices are justified. There are great restaurants in the area that offer good food and are more competitively priced. Highlights were the foie gras and the cod. Their specialty salt+charcoal cocktail was spicy heaven!

Very good izykaya. The menu is extensive and everything we tried was amazing. I was with one other person and we wished we had more people with us so we could try more dishes. I always love seeing ChÅ«hai on a menu! Wagyu rib-eye roll was delicious and presentation was lovely, came with a sesame risotto. The homemade soba was great, and the Shiogama Scottish salmon was one of the best pieces of salmon I've ever had, very tender, presented in a salt shell to preserve moisture and cracked table side. Will be back to try more!!
Excellent food and service. Â Perfectly seasoned and cooked meats...Just need to work on the pace of delivery. Â Slow is very in right now...

Went out for Halloween and found this spot by accident. Got lucky cause the menu is original, the service at the bar was on point, and the quality of the food/drink was superb. The variety alone will have us returning - we like Japanese robata style cooking while drinking at the bar, maybe this can be considered Japanese tapas? Anyway, this place is a gem and we're psyched to have found it. Certainly coming back.

This place is wonderful! Really! I came here last weekend with a friend and we started at the bar had a few cocktails made by a really welcoming bartender (Alexa?). The yuzu mule was sooo good! We had the shrimp crunch roll while waiting for the table and it was definitely one of the best shrimp crunch rolls I've had. Not your basic boring one but really flavorful! Once we sat down we had the warm tofu, the pickles, the selection of 7 skewers, Â the chicken meat ball, and some soba noodles. Everything was incredible! The skewers where my favorite this followed by the chicken meatball. The restaurant was pretty full when we went but our server was so nice and accommodating. She made sure to explain a few of the items would take a while to cook, but that was no problem at all! We just sipped on some excellent hot sake while waiting! If you go definitely get the wagyu skewer! It was my favorite!

I came here for their Valentines Day prix fixe which was an incredible steal at $60 for 6 separate courses each. Â My bf and I got the meat and fish choice. My favorites included the chicken nanban zuke, the rabataya rolled wagyu skewers, cod (didn't lie the grilled veg with it.. They were still too raw), the house made soba, shrimp roll, and the green tea cake and mochi and green ice cream. Â I didn't like the wagyu roll (the jalapeÃ±o on it was overbearing). Our non Japanese waitress was very sweet and knowledgeable about the food despite how authentic Japanese it was ( the robataya uses charcoal and wood from Japan and the kitchen staff is Japanese). The space is beautiful and the open kitchen is very clean and had a great vent system... We sat right next to the open kitchen and we didn't smell like food at all! Â They tried to seat us downstairs but I requested to be over by the kitchen booths. I wouldn't recommend downstairs for a date. It's better for a private party. Â Will definitely recommend this restaurants to my friends and be back myself.

I went here with boyfriend. We had a great time. The food was great and waitress help us pick out wonderful food choices. I would go back again. The restaurant was clean and spacious. Music was great and food again was great!!

Amazing food. The best beef Wagyu rice and shrimp toast I have ever had. Â The quail eggs are a must. Â Our server Alexa and the rest of the staff were wonderful. Â Highly recommend for food and staff.

Waited an hour and a half for delivery. When I called, they kept telling me it would take ten minutes. Then I would calle 30 minutes later and they told me the same thing. I don't know what it's like to eat here, but make sure you never order from them. Many other options in Williamsburg for good sushi.

I am so happy that this place opened because I live just a few blocks away form the restaurant. I walk by there everyday and I see the beautiful marquee sign. I've been wanted to try this place for a while, so finally we went in last weekend. My wife and I had an amazing dinner there. Place were nicely decorated and servers were very helpful. We chose Omakase for two. Start with hand made tofu, then Sashimi, Grilled fish, Grilled meat, Sushi and so on. Everything tasted amazing and very authentic. I am so glad that we don't have go in to the city to have this level of quality Japanese food. We will be back very soon!!!

Love this spot!! Great food- have never had anything I didn't like from the menu! The fried chicken is insane! Great drinks- watch out for the Â Oolong hai! The staff is amazing- super friendly and efficient and the vibe is just right. Check it out for yourself!

Mellow lunch. Terrific service. Charming but not cloying atmosphere. Excellent unagi roll- the miso soup that came with it was good too. Haven't been here in the evening but I'm really impressed by the beauty and chill of this place - I work nearby and will make it a regular spot for sure.

i came back during opening week. Â i expected service to be rocky, and it was. Â all the food we ordered was good, but i felt it was really overpriced considering the portion size. Â i'm talking like a regular mushroom skewer (nothing fancy like enoki) came out to over $1 per small, sliced piece. Â the salt baked fish had excellent texture and flavor, but the portion wasn't even an FDA standard meat/fish portion (it was smaller than a size of playing cards). Â i also wasn't in love with my small, pricy glass of sake. Â one star off for the inflated price. Â i'd definitely be a regular if they either lowered their prices slightly or made their portions bigger!

food was excellent, drinks are awesome and the atmosphere is exceptional.. the service was a little slow, took some time to get our drinks and food to be delivered and it wasn't very crowded, it is a Friday night but overall a positive experience.

This review is well overdue. I went for my birthday in January, I was actually trying to eat at a different restaurant but they had no seating available, upon calling Casa Tulum they had a table for me and my group within 15 minutes! The ambiance was amazing, the music was playing just enough where you could hear your table but not the table next to you, it's also very clean and the staff was very kind. Who I believed was the boss went out of his way to make me a special drink when I told him it was my birthday and it was absolutely delicious, the whole table ordered it afterwards. He also told us that all of the ingredients used (aside from the meat) are directly imported from Mexico in order to better enjoy true Mexican cuisine! 10/10 I would definitely come back, it was overall an amazing experience

This place is incredible! The atmosphere was great the decor was very pretty. I appreciated the staff not rushing us and they were very kind. One star off because the guacamole portion was very small for the price. Everything was delicious but portion wise and for the price the appetizer guacamole should have been double.

My friends and I planned to go to dinner at a neighboring place but they were closed for a private event. So we decided to meet here instead. Best. Idea. Ever. I'm picky about Mexican food. I've lived in Mexico. This is some of the best Mexican I've had in the city, hands down. We shared guacamole to start and it was super fresh. I opted for the enchiladas for my main. The sauce was delicious and the chicken tender. My friends had various tacos, rice, and elote. All very well flavored. We shared the churros with Mexican chocolate for dessert. The service was lovely. We met the manager Louis as he made an effort to come over and say hello and welcome us. Apparently they're not even a month old. But I'm certain they'll last for years to come. Buen provecho!

I wasn't sure about coming here bc there aren't a lot of reviews- they just opened and I'm so glad we went! The drinks, food, service, the place is brand new and so cool! We got the Al pastor tacos, queso fundito (was going to take pics but we ate them) Mole duck, enchiladas and they were all VERY authentic, filling- wouldn't have changed a thing. This is our go to spot before iPic! Oh also got the Inca maya, a pomegranate drink and a spice mart type drink, all were phenomenal

Visiting here from Vegas & I can say it is such a nice spot, giving Tulum vibes forsure. Got talk to one of the owners Luis & he was super friendly & welcoming. Food was good! Dessert was even better! Definitely a must go to place.

No comment

Honestly a terrible experience here. Food and drinks were terribly sub-par. Execution of cooking the meats was really bad - my boyfriend's duck was chewy, and my steak was not cooked to the right temperature I ordered (med-rare). The staff was friendly enough but very undertrained. It is clear that the owner is more concerned with his friends and Instagram posts than gaining and maintaining loyal guests aka long term sustainability. He was chatting with two girls, giving them free drinks, entertaining his friends and even gave my drink to them that I ordered since they wanted the same as soon as they sat down (after I ordered). No one checked on us to see how we were liking the food (we didn't), and it took nearly 15 minutes of us sitting there with our food in front of us to get someone to notice we wanted the check. The restaurant was pretty empty so busy-ness isn't an excuse. It was our anniversary and we paid nearly $250 for drinks, apps, and entrees that were underwhelming to say the least. Not to mention it was freezing cold and the staff kept opening the door to move chairs and tables around. Honestly just a poor and disappointing experience all around. Sucks too because I was very excited to go here. Will not return.
No comment
Fresh Flavorful Foods, impeccable service, delightful cocktails, and such a beautiful decor, really marvelously done! you can taste and feel the LOVE

went to this restaurant for Valentine's Day. the food was great and so were the drinks. The service wasn't so great. We waited 40 mins for our entree on a night where meals were pre selected basically. Then it took another 20-30 mins to get the check. seems like they're overwhelmed at times. The servers were very nice and apologetic.

We were incredibly disappointed in our experience at Casa Tulum. In addition to finding the food underwhelming (which was the least of our concerns), we had a horrible experience with respect to dietary restrictions: I am gluten free and upon ordering our appetizers I informed our waitress and asked to confirm everything we had ordered was gluten free. She said yes. When we ordered our entrees I once again reminded her I was gluten free and she confirmed again that yes everything we ordered was gluten free. I bothered to double check and ask her specifically if the tortillas they used for our meals would be corn or flour (as flour tortillas are not GF) and she confirmed that everything would be gluten free. Our meal arrived and in the darkness of the restaurant I could barely see my food. I bit into my tacos and about 2 bites in I realized I was most definitely eating a flour tortilla. I immediately called the waitress over, reminded her of the fact that I was gluten free (for now the fourth time) and asked if I was in fact eating a flour tortilla that would have gluten in it. Her response was the equivalent of "oops" and her only resolve was to bring me a corn tortilla on the side. Thank GOD I do not have a serious allergy (though I was ultimately up all night ill as a result) but I cannot imagine what would have happened if I did. On top of all that, she didn't even bother to remove the item from our bill. I have never experienced such poor service with respect to dietary restrictions and this restaurant and the treatment I received truly is so dangerous and potentially deadly for some. If you are a person with any sort of dietary restriction I would NOT go near this restaurant.

Popped into here for a quick snack, and it was such a pleasant surprise. I wasn't expecting a full Japanese grocery store complete with a wonderful array of prepared foods. I ended up getting some chicken karaage and a cha shu onigiri. What I thought would be a quick bite on the train ended up being me just demolishing these because they were delicious. The karaage was moist and perfectly salted. Even though it had clearly been made hours before by the time I got to them, they were still crispy. The cha shu onigiri had nice chunks of tender fatty pork throughout the rice and was also well-seasoned. It was much better than the onigiris I had in Hawaii. Both were pretty reasonably priced for NYC. I tried to come back later in my trip but made the mistake of coming during lunch hour on a weekday, and the lines at the register were insane. I'm definitely coming back but will try to make it during an off-peak hour.

I love rice. I love rice balls. Omusubi Gonbei has all sorts of ride balls! Great as a snack, breakfast or lunch on the go; I drop by 1-2x/ week to pick up a bunch and toss in the fridge then grab and bring w me to work and they come in clutch on busy days when I have back to back patients and not enough time to go out to get fresh food or to sit down to a proper meal. Reasonable prices. Could I have made this on my own at home? Yea, I have all the ingredients and know how to and have done it during student days, but busy work life has meant searching for quick solutions that will also preserve the joys of life. Rice balls bring me joy; omusubi gonbei it is!

Small Japanese convenient store with lots of prepared foods including sushi and nigiri. Prices were decent. I had some onigiris and takoyaki. Good takoyaki but a bit soggy as expected because it not made to order. The onigiris were ok. Rice is nicely seasonedbut there isn't much filling. All the foods seemed to have been freshly prepared. They were still warm.

it was ok not good as i expected. the amount of rice was alot but the amount of meat was little. Lucky that i ordered ramen and it so good that i can use the soup to eat with it. Maybe im not a big fan of these. If you in the area why not try see if it fit your taste
No comment

Love the onigiri choices here. It's a great snack to have in a pinch. I tried the spicy tuna, salmon, and spam musabi. You can't go wrong with any of those choices. Nice sticky rice. Good location since it's near Grand Central Station and it's located within a Japanese grocery store that reminded my of the 7-11 locations in Japan.
Very nice and unique selection of fresh onigiri and Masubi. They have brown rice options and have some pretty flavorful offerings.
No comment

I found this little gem while searching for a quick, casual lunch spot near Grand Central. Such a great Japanese convenience store with lots of prepared food options. I only tried the spicy tuna, salmon and chasiu pork onigiri and spam musubi but they were all delicious and filling. Â Only complaint was the ratio of rice to filling. A little heavy on the rice but since the rice was cooked perfectly, I didn't mind. I also noticed that they offered ramen with a couple of small tables if you choose to dine in. This place reminded me of the convenience stores in Asia. Wish there were more places like this around the city!
No comment
A bit hard to find, this is on a side street, inside of a grocery store, but a good selection of different musubis that weren't too expensive. Great to take on the go!
Best Japanese rice ball shop in nyc. Prices are super affordable between $2-4 for your most basic veggie base to the bomb with salmon and tuna. Authentic and a great snack or meal.

Was looking for Japanese food in midtown East and was so excited to see that there was an Omusubi Gonbei (they have a location in 'Mitsuwa which my siblings and I all love.) i got a kakiage rice ball and a fried oyster and my mom got a kombu one I think. I also picked up a chasu pork for my SO. The kakiage was Â  oyster was great too though there was too much mayo for my liking (though, I am also someone who largely dislikes mayo ). There are a ton of options here and they're all still if not warm than at least not cold (unlike the refrigerated onigiri you get at most grocery stores). If you like onigiri and are close by I definitely recommend picking something up!
No comment

Fantastic little Japanese onigiri stand inside Katagiri Japanese market. It's CHEAP!!! You can actually eat a meal for under $5!!! They have Natto (fermented soybean), kombu (seaweed), ume (picked plum), mustard greens, many brown rice and veggie options. They also have tuna, salmon, etc. Some Japanese shops don't get the rice to filling ratio correct. This one is PERFECT!!! Not too much rice, and the rice itself is perfectly seasoned so it's full of flavor. I would come by again for some nice snacks when I'm on the go.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Gosh this place is fantastic. I've been to the one in Mitsuwa Marketplace and Katagiri. The Katagiri location didn't have anyone manning the station but the wide variety of musubis were placed out to grab and take to the register. They have all kinds of flavors from traditional (ume, salmon) to more adventurous (spicy chicken, takana, eel). You can't go wrong with the classics like salmon and spicy tuna but the spicy chicken is really good. They're so fluffy and huge. Two of them would be more than enough for a meal. They are kept warm somehow and are just so satisfying to bite into. They're freshly made and ready to eat. No need to assemble like the ones you get in some markets/convenience stores. If you're looking for something quick and filling don't sleep on this option. Katagiri has lots of good drinks, bento, and sushi to go along with your musubi as well.

Wide selection of (cheap!) Japanese rice balls. Shop is tiny but packed with goodies. I tried the Takana (pickled mustard greens) and Ume (picked plum) and they were both very tasty! Not sure if they're family owned but the Takana reminds me of æ¢è made by my Chinese grandma

It's a little stand inside a japanese grocery store. My favorites are the mentaiko and shiso. The seasoned egg one is also pretty good too. Prices range from $2.50-$4. Personally, I get full off two rice balls. They're great for morning hangovers. The staff is also always friendly. Can't complain about anything. They run out of variety as the night gets later though so make sure to come before like 4pm.

Came here early in the morning with my wife for an easy breakfast. There's a pretty wide selection of rice balls here and I wanted to try everything! The prices are pretty reasonable so it seems like a good snack or meal if you get multiple. We ended up getting a couple of the mentaiko, salmon, eel, and the bomb. They're pretty big, especially the bomb. The eel and the bomb were both pretty good and had a decent amount of filling and overall a good flavor. The rice was good quality as well. My personal favorite despite it being the cheapest was the mentaiko! Flavorful but also not overwhelmingly salty.

Their onigiri rice is so soft and well seasoned. We got the nitamago (the soft boiled soy sauce egg), shiso, fried oyster, and eel -- all super delicious! Only regret was not buying more to take with us on the plane
No comment
Every weebs food dream. Come before 7 if u want onigris. Come after 7 if u want cheap af sushi

Difficult to find the store since the map was directing me to another area. The shop is small but service was quick! Inside seems to be a market selling some Japanese snacks and groceries. I got a variety of different things to try and my favorite was the fried oyster rice ball. The food is better fresh and was filling. Would come again for a quick bite for my train ride :)

Was in the area after brunch at little Collins and wanted something to nibble on my flight back. It is tucked in the front of the japanese market. I wanted the spicy tanaka but they were out, so I opted for the shiso/mackerel which was HUGE. I can make my own making rice ball but this one was good. I was worried that since it was so big that it would be flavorless and dry but nope, it was perfectly seasoned. Would try some other flavors. Like the spam and egg, unagi and spicy tuna next time

Stopped by here to grab a few musubis and I believe it was a spicy salmon don? All very good and tasty, especially the spicy salmon! I had a flight the same day, wish I could have ate these on the plane home. Great little market in NYC for an out-of-towner! Thank you! :)

.I love the fact they have different favor of rice but maybe i'm greedy, i think it they add little more meat in it would be taste better. It also need little more favor for me. It taste better after i dipped it in ramen. For the price it is not bad for what i pay for. would i try it again. Maybe. Just not my favor.

Only tried the takeaway onigri and all 3 choices were super yummy. I hope to return and try some more. They clearly labeled the veg options too. The shop itself is cute and has lots of Japanese food essentials. Definitely recommend if you want some inexpensive, filling, quick, yummy food.

After spending some time in Hawaii and eating spam musubi every morning, Omusubi Gonbei definitely more than scratches that perpetual spam musubi itch. Not much more needs to be said other than to come here in the morning to grab some freshly made and delicious musubi/onigiri.

So yum and so fresh! Â We got an assortment including the oyster, natto, and mentakio.

Unbelievably skimpy on filings. You're better off buying the rice balls from the supermarket because you'll be paying a dollar less for all that rice. My chair siu rice ball had 3 pieces of meat. 3 pieces that are each less than the size of a dime. Spicy tuna was literally a nickel size worth of tuna. Such a ripoff.

We ordered a few types of musubis to try and relive our trip to Hawaii. They were not at the same level. Rice was a bit dry and fell apart. And the fillings didn't have the right level of umami. If your in the area, give it a try. We couldn't find any other place that specializes in onigiri/musubis.

My life partner took me and our other life partner to Omusubi and I've been obsessed ever since. Must try their balls! All their balls are a great choice. Sushi is delicious. My favorite place

A staple lunch for me that's quick and delicious. Miso clam soup and rice balls with salmon. Also bring some home for hubby as a treat. Everything is so good it is no wonder the line inside goes to the back of store. But it moves and you get to look at other products.

The onigiri is super delicious. The rice was soft, warm, and fluffy. The two women working the station were gently handling the rice and transforming them into a balls of yumminess. I will be coming back on my next visit.

I placed an advance order for 40 omusubi/onigiri for a party, and they were beautifully prepared on time for pickup, with 'happy birthday' kindly remembered and written on the box. A delicious, great value that is tidy to eat, fills you up, and uncommon enough to feel special. Thank you to Zack and the rest of the Omusubi Gonbei team!

I stop by at least twice a week! They have so many different flavors and are really affordable in my opinion. Plus it's attached to the Japanese grocery store so I can pick up some groceries as well. It's my go-to quick lunch spot.

Super delicious for a great price! I'm vegetarian and got the seaweed onigiri and veg tempura onigiri. It was a great takeaway lunch!

Absolutely love this deli. They offer so much food in such a small space. They have rice balls, ramen, snacks, Mochi, and everything you can imagine. I came here on a cold day for some ramen and honestly it was so delicious. I ordered the #1, the broth was so good and not too salty. The pork belly was so tender and soft at the same time. I love every bit of this ramen . Would definitely come back for their other rice dishes!

Such a great, easy and very delicious on the go meal. Packed with good carbs, protein and flavor. Such a simple thing to get but so satisfying for such a reasonable price which is one big thing I look for. Not only is it good but they are heftier than they seem so able to fill you up! Definitely will be going back frequently to pick one up every once in awhile!

OMG, such a hidden gem! The rice balls are huge with generous fillings, made fresh daily by the nicest people, prices are super reasonable. My favorite item to bring on a plane ride since it's pure comfort food!!

The food is pretty good but it takes way too long to get help if you want something quickly to go. Take your money to sunrise mart just 2 blocks down.

I like you Omusubi Gonbei, I like you a lot. Prime location and service was great. I will have to admit, Pickled Plum was really incredible. I think that I might have a new favorite dish now. The team was extremely friendly and service is outstanding. Omusubi Gonbei...What a great spot.

These are great rice balls, just like you would get from an omusubi counter in Japan. Located inside Katagiri Japanese grocery/convenience store, you order at the Omsubi Gonbei counter and pay at the Katagiri register. I tried a salmon onigiri and a mentaiko onigiri. Both were packed with evenly distributed fillings. The quality of the food was great - the rice was cooked well. While you don't get the crispy seaweed from a pre-wrapped rice ball, you do get a better quality product overall between the rice and the fillings. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area!
Tasty and fresh onigiris! The rice was soft and had plenty of fillings. Great deal for the quality and taste. Staff is also very friendly - I look forward to coming back!

Really cheap and great lunch deals! Each rice ball is $2-4 tops, and the sides are just as inexpensive. The rice balls are massive compared the the smaller and flatter rice balls from other rice ball chains. I ordered the bomb rice ball (comes with tuna, salmon, and soy marinated kelp). Highly recommend this, great combination of flavors if you want a sampler all in one and can't choose between multiple fillings. The spicy tuna was equally delicious and very filling. Thought it would be mostly rice and very little filling, but there is actually a decent amount of filling inside. You can order from the counter and have them pack it for you or you can head further into the store and check out the deli section where there are more bento boxes, drinks, etc. They also have a prepacked lunch deal in the deli section during weekdays that comes with 2 rice balls and the karaage! Will definitely be stopping by again to try other rice balls.
No comment
So glad I stumbled across these guys. A large array of options, large portions, and really affordable prices for fresh, warm onigiri. I have already recommended it to friends!
No comment
No comment

I haven't found a place that sells amazing rice balls like the ones you find in Japan so I was exited to try these. The employees are super friendly and you can watch them make the rice balls but these just aren't for me :( The flavor was good but it was way too much rice. I felt like I wasn't getting enough of a filling to rice ratio in every bite (and I love rice too!)

Cheap, quick and tasty! I love !!! They have a selection to choose from and you can just stop by and grab a bunch for a snack or lunch. Best yet it's in a Japanese grocery store so you can get more food if you want. I grabbed an eel and ate it in the plane when I got hungry and it absolved me of my hunger and it tasted great. The eel was soft and the rice was cooked perfectly.

A simple concept well-executed. Perfect place to pick up lunch or a snack. I'm so glad there is a place right in midtown where I can get tasty and well-priced onigiri along with other Japanese groceries inside Katagiri. Having purchased these a few times and tried several various types including the bomb (a large onigiri with three types of filling), my favorites are the Mentaiko (spicy seasoned cod roe), spicy salmon, and ume (pickled plum). I've been generally satisfied with the proportion of filling to rice, just the right amount to get some filling with each bite of rice. The little stand isn't manned all day--towards the end of the day they leave the remaining rice balls individually wrapped in plastic wrap on the counter with clear price lists so people can just pick up and check out. Better to go earlier in the day for the widest range of selection--by the end of the day some of the varieties are sold out.

This stuff was the perfect mid-day snack to fill us up but not too much before dinner. #37, the bomb, was so freaking delish- right amount of spicy, perfect amount of filling, but the real winner is how the seaweed is easy to bite through and keeps it's shape the whole time. The Japanese grocery store attached is really awesome too.
No comment

Our friend took us here on our way to catch a train at Grand Central (across the street) for a day trip during our NYC visit. Somewhat a musubi connoisseur, he proclaims the ones made here the best in the US, even better than Hawaii. Certainly more appetizing choices than Bachan's. The store is inside a Japanese grocery market. We had fun eating these fantastic rice balls with a variety of delicious fillings.

This is the best onigiri in Manhattan with the most variety as well. They must have like 40 different kinds of onigiri! Crazy! It was so good - my favorite is the cod roe, just like being back in Japan :).

As someone who always visits NYC on a budget I really thrive off of finding cheap eats and this is one of my favorite places to stop by. The place is located inside a small Japanese market that as well has great prices. The food is great and decently sized. Can't wait to come back!
Delicious onigiri. Â I get the spicy tuna and it never disappoints. Â Fast, friendly service. Â Perfect for when you want a quick bite. The rice is perfectly cooked. Â Definitely recommend.

I was craving for onigiri. I decided to check out this new place in the neighborhood (inside katagiri store). There were a lot of variety to choose from and i got "The Bomb" and the Salmon rice balls. After getting back to the office, I was excited to take a bite at this amazing looking rice ball. However, my excitement turned into a disappointment. The rice was plenty, the flavor of the rice was bland and the meat was barely any to be seen. Â I just ate half and threw the rest away. Also. For the price, I would expect more ingredients in the rice ball. I would not recommend this place if you are craving for onigiri.

Love coming here for a quick lunch. Really affordable ($2-$3 each) and filling. Two pieces can probably fill most people up, but sometimes my eyes are bigger than my stomach and grab three. They also have brown rice options which aren't as traditional but still really good.

This is the only place I buy onigiri. The rice is imported from a specific rice farm in japan and polished in New York. So, it has a much sweeter and fresher taste than other rice. Some people complain about the amount of filling. But, onigiri are about the rice and it's the best in the city. I recommend the regular shiso, the plum with brown rice, the regular mustard leaf, the eel, and the fried oyster for fun.

I am a huge fan of this store and all the people who work there. Â The service is friendly and warm, especially from Mika and Tiffany! I work next door and the variety of Japanese food is awesome Â !! I highly suggest all the different onigiri and rice balls !!
Fresh ingredients and amazing rice (yes the rice matters as much as, if not more than the fish). Â Prices are reasonable. Â Come early as selections are limited and once they're gone, they're gone!
Picked up 5 onigiri yesterday. Â  They were great and very inexpensive. Â  That's a winning combo!

This is my go-to place for a filling and satisfying meal for under $10. My favorite onigiri are the grilled eel, katana (pickled mustard greens) and shrimp tempura. Most of the onigiri are around $2 with the exception of the eel and tempura ($3). I usually get two onigiri and a cup of the tofu miso soup for lunch and that gets me through the afternoon. Counter staff are always very friendly and quick. Love this place and so happy to have this as an option near my office in a Midtown east wasteland of overpriced chopped salad places, delis and bakeries.

I love this place. Best riceballs, they only come to the West coast near me once a year for a pop-up shop and I count the days!
worth the midtown lunch visit - rice triangles (onigiri balls), sushi and japanese grocery. kinda like cafe zaiya but also distinct. check out the fried chicken (karaage)

Loved visiting Omusubi Gonbei. Just a delicious as in NJ. The service was even better and more helpful. Definitely plan to return soon for rice balls, fried chicken and miso soup. Such a great, convenient location.
Gem of a place for quick tasty snack, groceries or a bowl of ramen. Â Fried chicken is a winner!
Haven't tried the ramen yet but tasty fresh rice balls (eel is better than salmon) and the fried chicken looked pretty tasty too.

This is a fantastic addition to the NY food scene. Omusubi Gonbei prepares Japanese rice balls like my Mom's. Portions are ample, prices are low and there is a wide variety. Forget being on a low-carb diet. These are the best rice balls outside Tokyo (or maybe LA).

Thanks to NYTimes and Ligaya Mishan, I was able to try this on my recent visit to New York. I was NOT going to miss out. I ordered the Bomb, salmon, tuna, sardine and something else that I can't remember. They were all good. I even took what I could not eat back to Chicago. They survived the flight and the cab ride home. I purchased these items at around 10:30 am Eastern and ate most of it at 7:30 pm Central. They were still delicious!!!

Karasu is a Japanese speakeasy hidden behind a secret door inside Walter's, and has been my go-to for special occasions since before the pandemic. Their art deco interior paired with dimly lit private tables create a sexy, intimate atmosphere - especially as you sip on their unique twists on classic cocktails. Order the Koji Ribeye, for sure!!! I've been to my fair share of Japanese steakhouses, and this cut was seasoned and cooked to PERFECTION. Always one of the most memorable dishes that come to mind when friends or coworkers ask for restaurant recommendations. Definitely worth the drive out from Queens or Long Island, I will continue coming for as long as they remain open.

Great experience. Extremely attentive and one of the best bartenders ever! She explained the cocktails and food and didn't rush us. Nonjudgmental Â like many of the pretentious restaurants. Food was flavorful and simple in a good way. Excellent ingredients.

Everything we got was delicious and felt special (hamachi, Tuna, yaki imo, oysters). The oysters were particularly memorable- we contemplated getting a second order! Sat at the gorgeous bar, the whole place has a very sexy vibe and would be a perfect date spot.

Absolutely one of my favorite dining experiences. We had to order seconds of some of the dishes because they were that good. This IS the first date restaurant you've been looking for. Make reservations for a friday or saturday, the atmosphere is perfect.

Karasu is a hidden gem located behind a secret door of Walter's, in the Fort Greene area of Brooklyn. Once inside you will find a beautiful and well designed space which includes a elegant bar and table seating. Food, service, and atmosphere are all top notch here. Tables were consistently full so you may want to book a reservation if you are dining during peak hours. Highlights of the meal for me included fresh oysters, duck wings, lobster pasta, and a perfectly cooked and seasoned rib eye. Come and dine at Karasu before the secret gets out!

The steak is to die for - the best.

Everything was excellent at Karasu.

Delicious food and cocktails but I'm still not sure it was worth the price tag. We prefer Walter foods/Walters. My fiancÃ© left hungry, which is no burnout after throwing down a couple hundred dollars for dinner. I thought someone might have wished us congratulations also, as we were celebrating our engagement, but they did not.
Delicious!!! If you like meat, I recommend the prime rib or else the smell of someone else's prime rib will invariably make you regret missing out on that. Drinks are very nice here.

Awful experience at this restaurant. We (a group of 3) arrived at the restaurant on Friday night and were told there was an hour-long wait. We left a phone number, but noticed, after over an hour of waiting, that no one called us. We went back to the restaurant and asked the manager when we should expect to be seated, given that we had been waiting for over an hour. The manager snapped at us, despite having treated him with calm and respect, and used a disrespectful, irritated, and condescending tone to indicate that we should not be expecting a table. We decided not to wait any further and left the restaurant disappointed at the dismal service and awful attitude.

We had delicious food and an excellent waiter. Four of us had a great mix of the tapas. The gazpacho is a definite get, as is the Lobster and Scallop. The mackerel was perfect, with salted crispy skin being a highlight. The chefs really understand the delicate balance of flavour, texture, smell and visual, and are able to craft a full sensorial pleasure.

This hidden spot in the back of Walter's has a great, romantic atmosphere. Service was also really solid, as was the tremendous sake selection. The food was underwhelming for the most part and very overpriced. The only dish we loved was the fried chicken appetizer. The rest was pretty bland - especially the udon main dish which cost $20 and the clam appetizer for $15. Nothing seemed to have any salt or seasoning. Portions are also quite small.

Watching an episode of Chef's Night Out brought us here, and we were not disappointed. Â I dig that this place is sort of like a speakeasy, where the restaurant is located behind a backdoor within another restaurant. Â The look of the place is very cozy and you feel enrobed within some secret society where they serve impressively delicious Japanese food that comes out of an even more impressively tiny kitchen. Â We didn't have reservations on a weeknight, but we were lucky enough to score two seats at the bar. Â We came for a snack, but ended up ordering about 4 or 5 dishes, that were all quite tasty. Â The most memorable and my favorite item was their Karaage Chicken followed by the Pickled Vegetables Three Ways which was the perfect acidic balance to the fried chicken. Â We also had the delicate egg custard, "Chawanmushi" but that took a little while to make. Â My husband was surprised by the Crab Salad (red crab, tofu, mentaiko, served with gyoza wrapper chips) and really seemed to have enjoyed that above all else. Â Me, I was going in on that amazing karaage chicken thigh! Â They serve nice, large chunks, that were meaty and juicy, but not oily, and just scrumptious, and actually the best karaage I've ever had. Â It would have been absolutely perfect with a warm bowl of rice. Â And we washed down our little "snack" with a refreshing yuzu soda, and it was overall a really delicious meal. Â I'd be thrilled to come back and try their infamous Koji Prime Ribeye, that looks hella dreamy based off all the photos posted here on Yelp.

If you've ever seen Inception, this is the restaurant version. A restaurant with in a restaurant?!? Â That's what you have here. In the back of a traditional American restaurant called Walter's, you can walk towards the back where the restrooms are and you'll find a nondescript black door that seemingly leads to nowhere. Open that door and your instantly transported into a Japanese izakaya speakeasy restaurant. Â The food is great, but the drinks are even better! I had some roasted asparagus and bamboo, raw octopus, and some tasty miso soup. Â My drink had a tequila base, but sported touches of ginger and jasmine. This trendy spot is one that you should definitely check out!

Noted there's a birthday celebration and the servers just seem over the night. Never checked if we were good or how the food was. Knocking over a glass on the birthday person and casually saying sorry cause you feel forced and walking away. Hostess was amazing. Food was good. If you're going to wipe all around the table don't be one handed and lazy, pick up the glasses in the way which would've prevented knocking a glass on my lap. I really wanted to like this place.

This place is a sparkling gem of a restaurant! You will feel instantly transported the moment you walk through the black door at Walter's. Staff and service are impeccable, and the vibe is cozy but not crowded. Drinks are FANTASTIC - my fave was the Night Night (sort of like a spicy plum Manhattan), and served in adorable vintage glasses. The food was outstanding. We eat a lot for two people, so we got two small plates and two large plates and it was perfect: miso potato salad, duck karaage, handmade uni pasta and sizzling prime rib for two. Everything was bursting with flavor, and the duck had one of the most unique sauces I've tasted in a long time. We had room for desert and got a scoop of maple walnut ice cream and sage ice cream. My husband liked the maple walnut and I was in love with the sage, so there was something for everyone. Would definitely go back again and again!

This was our second time to Karasu. We're fans of the food and the atmosphere. But last night, the miso soup was pretty tasteless. The server wasn't particularly friendly and a dish (the Japanese sweet potatoes) came out cold. When we asked the host if they were supposed to be cold- especially seeing as they came in tin foil and had butter in the side, he sheepishly said no, then returned to apologize and ask if he could offer us something else as there were no more potatoes. We assumed, given the situation that this would be on the house, it was after all a small dish that they brought completely cold and had no more of. So it was surprising to see them still charge us for the replacement item which totaled 12 bucks. I didn't say anything, it just felt like bad style and generally like the place isn't nearly as classy as it tries to appear.

This speak easy style restaurant is very intimate. It's located through Walters, lit but candles and frequented by couples. The menu is designed for sharing. We started with the Sweet Potato (highly recommend), karaage (highly recommend), and the mushrooms (eh). For our main we had the steak for two which was cooked perfectly. Our whole meal was delicious but WILDLY overpriced. The night finished at $200.... I was so disappointed. This is a place for extremely special occasions. Like my death.
No comment

No comment

No comment
Shortly after sharing the Ribeye I came to the realization that I just had the best steak I've ever had. Returning to this spot is a no brainer.
No comment
No comment

Great place for drinks at night or a date. Almost has a speakeasy feel with the separate bar and entrance at the back of the bar. Apparently their kitchen closes sooner than the front bar which closed its kitchen at 1am. I'd recommend.

'Secret Sushi' is what my family and I call it. Â It's in the back of Walters, and when you walk in, and go to the back door to enter Karasu, it feels as if you are quite important. Â It's fun! Â When you just walk in, the staff from Walters will usually say, "Oh! Â So, a table for (2)"? Â You will then say politely, "We're here to go to Karasu, the place in the back"! Â Then nod your head in the direction of the back door. Â They will then guide you to the back door and you will enter an entirely different restaurant, and it will feel like you are changing dimensions. Â We ordered the rice balls, which were a little bland by itself, but with soy sauce, they were much tastier. Â Inside the rice, there is salmon, which was a surprise as we thought it was tuna. Â Next I got the miso soup, and it was refreshing - although I think they could have added more tofu. Â For the main course, I received rice, (yes more rice), topped with sashimi, caviar, and corn. Â The sashimi's texture was amazing, and the corn was crunchy. Â As for the steak, it was perfectly cooked, tender and flavorful. Â The only thing was that there was way too much fat. Â It was kind of hard to eat. Â But the taste made up for that. Â I totally recommend this place for a special night out.
Have had good experiences here, nice staff, nice cocktail list. It's in a speakeasy environment, good for a date night.

Went here for my husbands bday. Â The food was amazing, one of the best meals I have had in a while! We ordered the sashimi , scallops , fried chicken (which I'm still dreaming about), pork tonkotsu and lamb noodles. Everything was delicious. Cocktails (manteca especially) and sake were delicious. Our server was so personable and everything worked out great. Definitely going back! Don't miss the spring veggie salad:)
No comment

Cute backroom restaurant/bar with good mix of tunes (and not loud.) Â My whiskey cocktail was good but not amazing. Â We ordered four dishes...unfortunately, two were fried, so while delicious, they weren't special - they were just fried food. Â The best dishes were the smallest in size. Â  Probably won't go back as it was expensive.

This is my go to spot for special occasions- b-day, intimate dinner with close friend(s), and the occasional treating of self to a special meal and drink. Quality food, drinks and service is what sets this place apart. Consistency through the years is what makes Karasu truly exceptional. First visit the week they opened, a few days prior to official opening, last visit the birthday of a dear friend in this year.

Karasu is truly a gem in Fort Greene. Â It's in the back of Walter's which is a great neighborhood restaurant, too. Â I've been twice and both times had the same server who was genuinely sweet, attentive, thoughtful, and accommodating. Â The first time went to celebrate my fiance's new job and she sent us some Japanese whiskey with our dessert. Â The second time, we went with my in-laws with dietary restrictions and she made sure that we were well taken care of. Â The space is intimate and cozy. Â I literally dream of the sauce served with the ribeye!

Go here for a cocktail. Sit at the bar and order something, anything with your favorite booze and you will likely taste flavor combinations you've never had before. Have another. Admire the vintage glassware and perfect decor and decide you need to upgrade your cocktail glasses and light fixtures at home. Get hungry and order a thoughtfully prepared nibble, maybe the fried chicken thighs and wonder how they manage to get them so crispy. Ask the bartender (who's an unassuming pro) to pour you something else, and be astonished by a delicate floral sake that's so good you want to take it home to sip in bed. You consider taking the bartender home too. Instead come back to this super sexy place with a date and do it all again.
Loved this place! Would have liked to try more items but was with a friend who is GF so our options were limited. Would definitely return!
No comment
Cute dark small space- they had us stand by the bar because the tables all had reservations. Good drinks but the katsu sandwich was amazing!!!

Drinks were great, karage and steak are excellent. Very cute and romantic setting with a speakeasy atmosphere. The salads were very impressive! It is Asian fusion, not quite authentic but dishes were very well prepared.
The Dippermouth was the best cocktail i've ever had. Beautiful interior design, awesome cocktail glasses...took me back to time spent in Japan!
No comment

Stopped by with a couple of friends. Reservations are a must. Drinks were delicious. I was looking for a vodka based drink and they were able to substitute the Gin for vodka in a drink called Bee Side which I highly recommend. We had some sashimi as well which was fresh and delicious. Try it out.
Great service and amazing food/drinks. I like the fact that it's very low key. I advise making reservations, tables go quickly.

Love the ambience of this place and the food was pretty tasty. Particularly the octopus and fried chicken. Not a big menu and more of a good spot for delicious drinks. We went on a Monday and it wasn't too busy yet service was pretty bad. Would go back for cocktails at the bar.
Great service, fantastic experience. Â This hidden gem is a Brooklyn treasure - must come and find the hidden secrets this has the unlock
In the back of another restaurant, really set up the mood once you get in. Â Good sake, tasty food. Â Had a very pleasant evening.

This place was good - a little over-hyped. I don't think we'll be back just because of the fairly small menu and the servers were a bit weird to interact with and seemed more focused on up-selling us vs. just being normal/nice. We were running 10 minutes late and they made sure to let us know we only had the table for an hour and a half. This was a completely fine amount of time, but it just felt kind of tacky. I personally don't like to know they are booking the tables that close together - to the point where they have to let you know what time to leave. The ambiance was cool; perfect lighting and noise level (good for a date). I thought the food was really good, so if you're willing to overlook the other things mentioned I'd give them four stars. I had the whole fish, which was amazing IMO - paired with this delicious white wine they had by the glass. My bf had the ramen, but he thought it was lack laster in comparison to others he's had for half the price. We also had the pickled veggies & warm potato with sesame butter (yum!). It's worth trying if you're looking for a new experience in BK!

i'm a little relieved i moved away from this neighborhood right as Karasu opened b/c i'd be here all the time if i hadn't. the drinks are unique and well-mixed, the food is perfection and the space is beautiful. such a great spot!

Cocktails are solid. Food is good. Sashimi small dish was aaawesome. Â Interior is Art Deco in a cool subtle kind of way. Lastly, I love when you can tell a waiter how hungry you are and they give a legit answer to if you have ordered the right amount of food. Our guy hit it spot on. Â Nice experience.

Fantastic experience, from the food, to the service, to the decor. We had multiple apps (the fried chicken was so good we had to order a second batch), the octopus, oysters, edamame (best I've ever had - with a nice amount of salt), miso soup, then moved on to the whole fish and rib eye. And, the buttermilk ice cream, with just a hint of "tang," was delicious! We cleaned every plate! I would absolutely recommend this hidden gem and, as an out-of-towner, truly hope I get to return!
I still give this 5 stars, quality is still solid from when it's existence wasn't even advertised yet. Great cocktails and good sake menu. The Koji ribeye for two was right on the money.
This is a terrific hidden gem behind Walters- go thru Walters to the door in the rear. The food is the best Japanese I've had in Brooklyn maybe all of NYC. Truly a find. Romantic space too. eat up!
No comment
My new local! I love this place. The staff is so charming, the menu is delightful, and they serve champagne by the glass.

I have been to Karasu many times, have brought family here and have raved about it to friends. Â I was a big fan and supporter. Â I came here last night and was utterly disappointed. Â We tried 2 new (to us) dishes - the shrimp and the crab salad. Â The shrimp was basically boiled shrimp with little extra flavor - nothing special (for $19), do not get. Â The crab salad was also disappointing - it was just small and the flavors were not there. Â The fried chicken was definitely good (we have always loved the fried chicken here) but it did not melt in our mouths like times past. Â The beloved ribeye, which we also usually rave about, was just not as good as previously - it was chewy in many parts and just did not meet expectations. Â I am hoping this was just an off night but the quality of the food seems to have gone down considerably and I can no longer congratulate it. Â Also a salmon starter dish that we loved before (I believe lightly seared and it also melted in your mouth) was off the menu - another disappointment and sweet potato jumped from $6 to $10! Â I hope Karasu works harder to regain quality they had previously.
Fantastic ribeye (we've come back just for the beef), good cocktails, and interesting apps/sides. Â Great vibe and mid-range prices. Â Nice foodie-oriented wait staff.

Eh. Atmosphere is cute but food was severely underwhelming, and drinks didn't live up to the hype. And it's expensive! There were lots of bones in the sashimi (!), and everything else (octopus sunomono, seafood udon, pickled vegetables, mushrooms) was bland and portions were tiny. Wouldn't go back!

Unfortunately we were not impressed. We go out to eat a lot, I read an article couple of months ago, saw pretty good reviews her on Yelp and decided to take my husband here (he did not want to go). When we came in we were pretty excited, the place looks very intimate, however once we took a look at the menu we were turned off. Menu is very limited, prices are way too high. We have been to quiet a few Japanese restaurants and this is by far one of the worst. The edamame does not need a citrusy zest, the eggplant was not anything special just a poorly pickled vegg, we really wanted some raw fish (they just offered good old herring which I would only get at a Russian restaurant), and the dorado was somewhat decent. I honestly would never go back, I was quiet disappointed that my husband stayed pretty hungry after we left since nothing tastes good it was just ok. We were hungry so we had to eat. The scotch is very very overpriced. You do not have to pay$ 26 for a mediocre scotch and barely an ounce pour. Overall i would not go back and do not recommend to get the dishes we got. May be others like it but if you enjoy good Japanese go to Zuma!

Creative dishes, excellent service, and overall amazing experience. Karasu is one of the best hidden gems in NYC. Its versatile vibe is well suited to groups of friends or a romantic date. This is a fast favorite for thoughtful Japanese dishes that are perfectly paired with craft cocktails. Led by two brilliant chefs, Karasu is set to be a fixture in the global culinary scene.

Small place, but cozy ambiance. Great drinks, nice bar Â nice staff, great food. Very small menu, but I have a weakness for tonkatsu and this is by far the best tonkatsu I've had in the US - maybe even in Japan because I didn't used to go to fancy restaurants there. The whole fish was also very good - maybe a tiny bit salty but done perfectly. Highly recommended.
Excellent! Loved the atmosphere, simplicity, and elegance of the small space. The food was excellent and the hostess pleasant and endearing.

Loved the whole experience! Worth the price - and a different kind of omakase experience. Very friendly staff too!

I would have given this place a 5 star. But me and my friend did have a stomachache after dinner. Wished that didn't happen. Besides that Everything was great! It's super simple. Each piece of the meat they seasoned it differently. If you do not like meat then this place is not for you. They cook it like a hot pot in front of you and then they dip it in a sauce for you to eat.

A great experience having shabushabu cooked and served one bite at a time. The beef melts in the mouth. High quality meat and yummy!!

Food was decent with many sauce. The beef was good from Miyazaki. Uni wasn't too fresh. Wonton was very standard. The tea was $4 and there isn't a refilled. Seaweed wasn't crispy. The environment is good. Expect to spend $148 per person, plus tax and tip, you should expect to spend $200. I came as a party of 2 so total spending is $400
No comment

The wagyu beef and sauce pairings were delicious - so succulent and juicy. You just want more of each bite. Whether it was the a5 wagyu beef, the American style wagyu or the pork belly, each bite was well thought out and worth savoring. The one reason this didn't merit 5 stars was the service. I mentioned my egg allergy at the start of the meal, and they highlighted the two dishes that could be an issue. They didn't really offer substitutions - just provided me with the dish sans egg. That was fine - until we got to the dessert, which was ice cream. It was one small scoop, and I ate most of it when the telltale tingling and swelling in my throat started. I asked the server if there was egg in the ice cream and she said yes. Suffice it to say, this was not the best way to end the meal. My husband was upset because this was our anniversary dinner, but fortunately, I was able to throw up my most recent bites. The servers expressed very little concern or remorse. And we paid and left. It's fortunate for them that I don't have a more severe allergy (worst is an upset stomach and hives). They had no way of knowing that, but for the amount you're paying and experience they're aiming to give you, you'd think they'd do a little more on the service side of things, especially when they made an error that could have ruined a celebratory evening.

This is the most innovative and fun Shabu Shabu experience by far. The quality and favors are magnificent. Being the first Shabu Shabu Omakase and to have this quality of execution is just superb.

Like the other review mention, service was great but it didn't have much variety. Â It felt repetitive after the 5th dish. Â I was expecting some fish or odd meat in between.. it's worth a try nonetheless
