This 20 course omakase is $150 a head and super delicious but somewhat overwhelming. Each course is delicately prepared in front of you and is the perfect bite each time. I got super full and fatigued near the end though with the amount of wagyu. It's honestly a lot of food for omakase but $150 seems a bit steep if you compare it to Hyun, which is ayce wagyu bbq at $135 pp. Very cool experience though, worth a try!

Overall, I liked this restaurant, but I thought it was overpriced for what it is. Â  The Omakase style for shabu shabu is an interesting approach, but, again, I am not sure the level of artistry was there to justify $145 per person. Â For example the Uni appetizer was a little one-note and needed a little brightness to balance it out. Â Same comment with the shabu shabu hand roll. Â The noodles at the end of the meal would have been better if served with a broth.

Shabu shabu omakase! Get your wagyu, washugyu, pork, all served with different flavors in 2.5 hours. They serve each piece individually so you get to really taste the flavors. Service is attentive and the counter is so clean and spacious. I love places with set menus so you don't have to think about what you want. Just go.
No comment
great service! The food was amazing! Would definitely recommend if you'd like to treat yourself and your loved one for a nice treat :)

Tasting menu + Shabushabu don't usually run in the same sentence. I've come here multiple times and have to say it's one of the most unique and best meals on New York. Have taken multiple friends and they love it! Highly recommend.

So far it's my favorite restaurant this year. If you love wagyu, 100% recommended. Just look at the texture of their wagyu, it's really A5 quality. Also the tasting experience is very unique. They prepare each single course so you don't need to worry if the beef will be overcooked. It was an amazing dinner
Perfect from beginning to end! A lovely and unique menu and excellent service! It was our second time there and it did not disappoint!

Very unpleasure experience. Waitress are rude and unprofessional. There are one hour remaining between two section. They were just keep telling you that you are fell behind and give you whatever they are finished.They don't care if you are ready for the next dish or not. Customer won't like to have a unpleasure meal for $200+.
No comment

Hands down MY FAVORITE shabu spot ever!!! The whole experience was super unique and personal. The place is very clean and due to covid they are only doing 2 seatings for dinner with 3 ppl max per night. Make sure you make a reservation!! Our waitress served and cooked us every single dish right in front of us. The quality is superb. All beef are wagyu and they feed you in 14 different ways! I have had a lot of shabu but I never had a shabu omakase like this! You also get a homemade soba in the end and omg that ice cream... everything was made to perfection. We left with a full stomach and felt like we were in Japan! Thanks for the top notch service. Can't wait to come back already!!

Such a unique experience. It is very expensive so I don't know how often I'll be coming again, but it is certainly worthwhile to try it at least once. The meat was absolutely sublime. The Japanese omelette in broth was another standout dish. Truly a dining experience unlike any other!
No comment
No comment

One of the best dining experiences out there. Each piece is crafted with such care and everything tastes out of this world. The amount of flavors you will experience in this meal is insane. All around a great treat for a celebration of any kind since the price is a bit steep but COMPLETELY worth it. Run. Don't walk.
It was a pleasant surprise, the food was exquisite and service was excellent Â - I'd preferred a table seating than counter seating
Each bite is fantastic. Wagyu melts in your mouth. A very intimate dining experience, overall worth the price for a special night.

All around amazing experience. Both wagyu was amazing, loved the innovative take on serving shabu shabu. Service was amazing, only 2 seatings per time slot. A very intimate setting, great place for a date!

One of a kind shabu shabu restaurant in NYC and I'm so glad I discovered it and gave it a shot. Very unique experience and top of the line quality cuts of meat. During Covid, they are taking 1 private party at a time so you get a very personal experience as the waitress prepares the whole meal piece by piece. All the different courses were full of unami flavor. The pictures don't do it justice; you will leave full and very satisfied. Â Highly recommend you visit, if you are a fan of shabu!

I'm so lucky because in this period of time I am the only customer, and we have table service only for us! The table service is there has a waitress helps you to cook for your Shabu-Shabu ! Totally has 20 dishes, and each of the dish has their own tastes. Very nice and full after the meal. 165 dollars per person is totally worthy to try because the service and dishes are so nice. Overall it's a very nice experience!
No comment

FANCY SHABU SHABU! I came here to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and the meal was phenomenal. We've been wanting to try this place for a while now and I'm so glad we did. So it's a whole course where the chef prepares the meat and food for you and then puts it into your plate so all you have to do is bring it to your mouth. They do it in front of you and you get to watch them swishing the meat into the water. The first piece of rib eye was mouth watering. It melts in your mouth and they cook it at a low temperature so it's not hot when you put it in your mouth but just right. Literally my eyes widened when I had the first piece and I was just craving for more. Every piece was amazing and went above my expectations. They started us off with a cup of sake and then moved into the salmon shiokara which was a little too fermented for my taste and i had 2 pieces of bone in it but after that it was a straight highway of heaven. My favorite piece was the first meat one with the A5 Miyazaki wagyu rib eye and then my second favorite is the washugyu rib eye with the blue cheese, fig sauce, balsamic sauce. This piece was very interesting because the combination worked so well and really left my mouth salivating even afterwards. I left the meal full and so satisfied. Would definitely recommend to try this place out and they do indoor dining so reserve and enjoy being taken care of!

Came back again and tried their winter 2019 menu. It's pretty much the same shabu shabu items but the appetizers changed slightly. Service is suser attentive and Mayu and her staff are very friendly. Food is amazing and they just put so much care and thought into their menu.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: New Yorkers are blessed with the excellence of the beef and service at this quiet and small shabu shabu experience. From the delicate presentation of the 'goods' to the single serve bites of Heaven. What a treat to be served every single mouthful of a shabu shabu meal. I would've called it crazy but I am absolutely enjoying myself as I write this review only halfway through the service. The properly measured out temperature of each beef 'bite' is truly a science worth studying which Mayumon clearly has perfected. The in-between dishes of enoki mushrooms, or mozzarella wonton show the creativity and care that has gone into the preparation of this meal, not to mention the flavorful blue cheese and balsamic Wagyu sauce. My favorite 'unique' item being the Wagyu temaki, a rice roll with seaweed and the best beef. Each bite is calculated and balanced. How does one make a bite last longer? You will find yourself asking this very question as you taste the tender Miyazaki Wagyu melt in your mouth at the perfect temperature of bliss. Don't take my word for it and come treat yourself to a journey of exploration for your taste buds.
Honestly, one of the best meals of life. Every piece of the meal blew my mind and the service was great. Certainly a one of a kind experience.
Absolutely fenomenal. One of my favorite places to go. Will not disappont! The chef is attentive and food is superb.

A truly spiritual experience, she has proven that even during these times we can still enjoy food that is cooked with love and passion, transporting us to an hour and a half of bliss. Could not recommend this place more. Thank you!
Amazing orchestrated experience and an adventurous journey of creative flavor combinations all beautiful and soft and plated artfully.

It was an extremely unpleasant experience. The waitress was very rude and gave incorrect cancellation info compared with what is presented on their website. When we made the reservation via Yelp, there was nothing about full charge for cancellation. We got there late for 18 minutes and we were told if it passed 15 minutes they would not serve any of the appetizers on the menu but we would be charged for the full amounts in a very harsh tone. They also said since we were late, they had the right to charge full and didn't serve at all but they were showing empathy to let us dine in. The truth is I didn't even have any card to hold the reservation, which basically means they couldn't charge me if I cancelled. Also, I checked back their website after dining with them, it was 20 minutes in stead of 15 minutes late that there would be chance they wouldn't serve the appetizers. After 30 minutes, they would charge full for no show. I understand the no show/late policy, but their attitude made me feel I did something extremely wrong and should be punished for it. The food was okay and like most of other comments here OVERPRICED. If you are interested in Wagyu beef, there are lots of options in town with better service and price. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone and would ask anyone to avoid at any cost.
Love this place, it's a different take on shabushabu. Â It's a lot more fusion than I thought it would be, but it was still very good. Great staffs! Super friendly

Wow, shabushabu Mayumon was truly brilliant. It was very reasonably priced. After going through the reviews I bought Salmon Shiokara, and it was so terrific, it is now my favorite dish. The team was really pleasant and service is fabulous. shabushabu Mayumon is hands down the best of the best in this area.
No comment
Personally I am a fan of Sukiyaki, but this Shabu Shabu is really a unique experience. Â The Beef, the sauce, the rice, they are all excellent!
Such ethereal food. Â Different menu than the original but apparently just as good. Â Quite the experience.
A perfect experience. The setting, the ambiance, the service, and OF COURSE the food, were all amazing. Could not recommend this place enough. Will be back again soon!

We chose this restaurant to celebrate our 29th wedding anniversary. Â It was the best decision! Â Chef Mayu welcomed us by name and offered a delicious glass of champagne on the house to start us off on an exceptional dining experience. Â The personal attention we received from her and her assistant as they prepared each dish in front of us was an added delight. Â Each item on the menu was delicious and beautifully presented. Â I loved the dishes and glasses that were used to serve our meal. Â Mayumon's loveliness just emanated and added additional "umami" to the food. Â We also enjoyed the Japanese rice beer and sake drinks that were offered on the menu. Â We've been to other fine dining restaurants around the world, but I would have to say this was definitely one of our top experiences. Â If you are wondering if you should make a reservation, stop overthinking it and just do it. Â This is a unique Omakase-style Shabu Shabu experience that I highly recommend without hesitation.
This was an amazing experience! Every course was really special, the atmosphere was superb and the service was 5 stars. Worth every dollar! Highly recommend!
The service is excellent. We were the only table at the time and the food was excellent. Willing to go back again
Very satisfying meat eating experience. Excellent cooking skill. The chef noticed my low tolerance of wasabi from the appetizer and asked me how much I want every time afterwards.

Family had a unique, delicious dinner experience at this wonderful, quaint, intimate restaurant. Â Each delicate piece of food (!) was prepared and presented to us with great attention to detail, taste, and service. Â Limited seating so very very special. Â Definately recommend and will be back!

I came here with a friend and we nearly cried at how amazing every single bite of the food was. It was so good that not even a month later, I made my partner come with me so that I could come eat it again. From the first bite of the first appetizer item to the extensive shabu shabu to the ice cream at the end, truly one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. I'll say it for the third time - I fervently wish Chef Mayu's hojicha ice cream was for sale, because I would hoard it and eat it every day.

Had a thoroughly enjoyable experience at this restaurant for my wife's birthday last week. This is a new location which we chose due to the impossibility of getting into their first restaurant. We were one of only two couples there, I think because the first seating is. early, 5:30PM. Two women prepared dishes for the four of us behind the counter--fun food theatre. It's a somewhat leisurely process due to some of the prep times for certain items on the omakase menu. Fresh, very high quality ingredients. Really was a nice, different dining experience. Highly recommended!

Incredible food, friendly and warm yet sophisticated service by Mayu and her trained stuff! Simply yet deeply flavored mushroom, Yuba uni appetizer are outstanding, A5 wagyu beef and washu gyu are extremely silky and juicy, especially A5 Miyazaki hand roll is just awesome... Even I have never experienced this Shabushabu OMAKASE style in Japan, everybody should have this amazing experience, Highly recomend!!

Amazing restaurant. Really love the vibe of the place. The food is really awesome like GOEMON(Alternative juicy healthy curry spot) it is really healthy with the ingredients on it being put. The staff really works well because of their positive attitudes towards it's customers. Very vibrant place.
No comment

I went back and tried the Enchiladas Placeras Platter and now I can see much more why people love this place. This dish consisting of, "3 red semi-fried tortillas in our grandmas red special sauce, filled with tinga or refried beans, topped with lettuce, tomato sauce and Cotija cheese," is outstanding and very much worth it for $13. The Tinga Tostadas are also good. Was also a fan of the Mezcalita. I guess when inside a MichoacÃ¡n restaurant, order MichoacÃ¡n food (who would have thought.) Will be back again likely to try the tacos MichoacÃ¡n as I haven't had a good version in a while.

Was craving some Mexican and wanted to try out somewhere I haven't been. Me and a friend walked by Purepecha and decided to give it a try and I'm so glad we did. We felt welcomed by the staff as soon as we walked in. The ambiance is very cute and they have a pretty large menu. We both got margaritas - I got the classic and my friend got the raspberry cadillac margarita which she said was really good. First order of chips and salsa was free and they were really good. I ordered the chicken quesadilla which came with guac and pico de gallo. My friend ordered the shrimp fajitas which were a pretty big portion. We both loved our meals and the service was great. Might be hard to miss with the scaffolding outside but definitely worth a try. I will be returning for sure in the future.

I take out here regularly as it is a solid Mexican place near me. In terms of price it is decent as I can always have enough for two meals! I have only tried the tierra y mar as I am a sucker for a good surf and turf. Also perk if you dine in is that you get free chips and salsa!

The restaurant is in a nice location and the atmosphere is nice. My husband ordered a margarita but they then realized they were out of ice so they sent a worker to go buy more. So he waited about 20 minutes for his drink but they very friendly and apologetic about it. They serve you one basket of free chips and salsa and the chips were obviously old. We both got burritos with grilled chicken. They were decent in my opinion but not as good as I was hoping for. Overall, this is a decent place to grab a bite to eat.

Hidden gem! We got these veggie tacos with avocados and huevos and also a veggie tostada to share. There are a lot more veggie options than I expected which was great, and the service here was so amazing. The waiter was so attentive to us and gave us thoughtful recommendations for food and drinks. Definitely want to come back again!

Ordered for pickup and Im so glad I came across this place. Pretty picky with my latin food. The chicken fajitas were fire. Not so big on corn tortilla but even that tasted good.

Â I like that I was able to choose the beans, the black beans have great flavor. Â The cheese was beautifully melted. Â The carnitas...wow...great seasoning and generous amount. Enjoyed this place! Â Lovely steak tacos and had the San Angel burrito! Â My little one had rice and beans. Â Staff was very friendly. Â Seems like a great place for margaritas (I did not have but they look delish). Will be back!

This place serves amazing food & margaritas the owner makes is so good lol The owner is super nice and he said he wants to make sure he serves food like he does for his family and I'm glad he opened this place and decided to share his love.

Two words " TRY THEM". Try the al pastor Tacos, Blackberry Margarita and the Queso dip w/chorizo! They never, evaaaaaaa disappoint. The al pastor tacos, they are always rich in flavor, fresh and flavorful. Whether you order to-go or have them there, they are just as delish! My favorite, in Cobble Hill/Carroll Garden area. We are repeat offenders of the Al pastor tacos here Â #Guiltyâ The service here is amazing, I never had any issues and we've been coming here since they opened. Would highly recommend.

There are not many great tacos places in Brooklyn Heights / cobble hill / carrol gardens, so this place is easily the best taco spot we have found so far. We got the carnitas, which is really good, on par with other great taco places. The shrimp tacos were also really good. The biria tacos were just ok, I would not get them again (it could be that you need to eat them right away and we got them for takeout). There are some others I want to try again, but in general this is a great spot, reasonably priced as well. Just wish you could order individual tacos - instead of the 3 per order.

Very relaxed setting and delicious food. I got the nachos with steak and couldn't wait for my main entrÃ©e. I also got the steak fajitas and they were delicious too! When I'm back in Brooklyn I will come back here!

I love this place. Authentic tacos. So good. I've never dined in. I've only ordered delivery but entire family enjoys their food and they are all super picky.

The food was great! The service and the bartenders were friendly, funny and respectful. Played really good music (mixture of all genres).
Yes I recommend the chicken burrito!! Â So delicious . I like to eat Â in places with authentic Mexican food.

This place is still very delicious! I haven't came since before the beginning of COVID. Purepecha has quite a few tables out for outdoor seating. We came for brunch on Saturday and was able to get seats right away (around 12:30/1pm). I ordered the bandera burrito with al pastor. The burrito is quite large. The al pastor inside was perfectly seasoned! It was juicy and so flavorful. The sauces on top of the burritos were equally delicious. We requested hot sauce and the server provided us a green sauce and an orange/red sauce. The orange/red hot sauce was, in my opinion, not too spicy, but had just the right amount of heat. I'm so glad we came here again!

Great quick meal. Enchiladas are the bomb and the Spicy Margaritas are tame but tasty. Not bad at all.

I've ordered from Purepecha a few times now and I can honestly say they have some of the best tacos I've had in the area. I've tried their carnitas tacos, the fish tacos, and the carne asada tacos, and they are all delicious. I moved here from San Diego and it's been hard to find good Mexican food out here which is why I'm soooo happy I finally found this spot. They also have really delicious salsa! The only thing I will say is that the food can be a liiiiittle salty sometimes. The flavors are on point but if you have high blood pressure or are trying to avoid salt for any reason then this may not be the spot for you, but other than that the food is truly delicious! I will definitely be a repeat customer

Solid authentic restaurant. I was by the area visiting friends and I stumbled upon this restaurant for dinner. I order the steak quesadilla along with the guac and chips. Steak quesadilla was juiced and full of flavor. They are generous with the guac and chips. I would recommend and come back when I'm craving Mexican food again
Very cute Mexican restaurant. Food was all very good, and I appreciated that they had a vegan fajitas option.

Ordered online when they appeared as a new listing for tacos in my area. A little less expensive than other spots nearby but also with fewer frills and smaller portion size so I guess everything's proportional. The al pastor tacos were a little lacking on the pineapple but otherwise pretty tasty. Delivery came in half an hour, under their estimated 40-60 minute window. Simple, delicious, what else could you ask for?

I absolutely love this place. The food is great the drinks are always strong and you get free chips and salsa with your order so even better :) The customer service is great as well Kevin and Marco are always sooooo friendly and inviting and that's what keeps me coming.
Just absolutely delicious Mexican food in every detail. Service 10/10, even the decor's nice. Really great little Mexican place.

I've gotten takeout here 3 times. Â I always order a carnitas burrito, but this past order I was given steak instead. Â It was flavorless and burnt tasting. Â I am not a steak person, so maybe this is normal, but I was disappointed with the inconsistency. Â The first 2 carnitas burritos were tasty and worth the higher than normal burrito price.
Love this place! The food is excellent and tasty and never disappoints. The service is fast, the drinks are strong. No complaints. (got excited and started eating before the pic)

I've been here a few times now, at first not super impressed but the more things I try - the more I love this place! Â The tostadas are delicious & filling, the chicken is tender and the toppings are plentiful! Â My friend loved the veggie (peppers/onions) burrito, and he's not vegetarian. Â My last visit, I had the nachos with chorizo - it was EPIC! Â The ground chorizo was amazing, I almost contemplated ordering a 2nd plate. Â The margaritas are decent, would like to see more options with mezcal.
go to spot for mexican, i have never ate there but we always order delivery and it's very good.

We had an excellent fish taco here. And I admit the service and ambiance were excellent. But all the other food we had- I'm not so sure it's worth all the hype. For example, the highly heralded carnitas tacos were just OK in our book. Maybe a bit below average if we were on the West Coast. And pricey... Just saying...

I came here for dinner with a friend. We shared chips and salsa and each had a margarita. She had the steak/chorizo tacos and I had the fish burrito. Everything tasted fresh. The margaritas were fresh and strong, with a slight tartness that was refreshing. My friend and I enjoyed our meals. Staff was very friendly and attentive. The restaurant is beautifully decorated - it's warm and inviting.

Really delicious and fresh, authentic flavors. We ordered a giant vegetarian burrito, chicken tinga, and guacamole and chips. The burrito was tasty, and the chicken tinga was perfect. Even the guacamole tasted better than your average, very well seasoned and served with homemade chips. Definitely give this place a try, you won't be disappointed!

The best Mexican in the hood. A bit more but worth it!! Staff is very nice and food taste quality and delicious. We usually get the San Angel Burrito, Â shrimp tacos duro, carne tostada, and chips and salsa - their ranchero salsa is so great too. And churros

Good service, nice that they have TVs to watch the games, but $14 dollars for a Michelada, Â C'mon.

Just came in to sit at the bar for Â drinks and a snack. Bartender was very friendly in conversation and drinks were good! Definitely a place to stop by if you are in the neighborhood looking for a quick and nice spot

My friend and I came on a weeknight and ordered house margaritas and shared chips and salsa. I was a bit sad that chips and salsa weren't included, but it was fresh & DELICIOUS so I was instantly happy we'd ordered them. The house margaritas weren't anything out of this world, but they were fresh and tarte- none of that overly sweet syrup. Thank heavens! The campechanos tacos have a spicy kick which made the margarita an even better choice. The warm glow of the mural made for a nice ambiance. Overall, a beautiful addition to the neighborhood.

This place has been on Smith Street for at least a year now and I finally decided to try their outdoor dining (due to Covid) about 3 weeks ago. Hmmm what can I see, the flavors are spot on when it comes to Mexican cuisine. I've tried their nachos, steak fajitas, Fajitas Mixta and shrimp tacos. Every dish has been super flavor full and service is great considering staff is low. Cocktails are amazing!! Enjoyable more so during the weekend when there are less people outdoor dining, but a def must try. The best place in Boreum Hill for Mexican hands down.

This is the my favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. The quality of food and drink is very good. The staff is nice and friendly. I've had various food from here and all of it is great! My recent order was steak nachos. Simple but delicious. Sorry, I took the photo after I started eating!

We had fish taco and surf&turf dish. Great chips and Salsa. If you like guacamole, then order the whole appetizer cuz the side is tiny. But the best part of our experience, was the service! The staff worked super hard with a large birthday party In the front, but the diners in the back was not neglected.
No comment

The tacos were solid. They were spiced correctly, tasty and a good portion of food. The shrimp quesadilla lacked flavor, had too much cheese, and overall was just bland. The free chips and salsa that came was also extremely bland. For the first time ever, I needed to add salt to my salsa. The customer service here is great though, as the workers were very friendly.

One of the rudest, strangest, jaw droopingly unbelievable experiences I've ever had in any restaurant anywhere. We had had drinks at the bar a few weeks back and decided to try the food last night. The place was about 25% occupied indoors. As we wanted to sit inside we requested that of the host who greeted us at the entrance. He rudely and abruptly demanded our vaccine cards and ID. I felt like I was in an episode of Seinfeld and the soup nazi was now working at Purepecha. We didn't say anything but reached for our vaccine cards (we are both fully vaccinated). As we did so the host then rudely demanded that we wear masks until we reached our table and referred us to the sign on the door. I put on my mask and started to read the sign which stated that only no-vaccinated persons were required to wear masks. It was at that moment I notice HE WAS NOT WEARING A MASK!!! I questioned him and asked why we (fully vaccinated) were required to wear a mask to our table when he (vaccination status unknown) could freely wander the restaurant all night long, speaking to people, around food, where his spittle might land on the food, the people, etc. He basically told us that the rules don't apply to him. Not sure why. Now we don't oppose wearing masks or not wearing masks and are compliant with whatever the rules are, but the hypocrisy was just amazing. You demand (yes, demand in a very rude manner) that we wear masks to our table but you don't have to wear one at all? Huh? I was so turned off by Â his attitude and his unreasonableness that I said we changed our mind and would eat elsewhere. As we were walking out he said "Good, Go". One last word and directive from him. I'm not sure who the owners of this restaurant are, and I know it's difficult to get help these days, but this type of attitude should not be tolerated or accepted. We wound up at Barbalu around the corner and had an amazing meal with kind people who appreciated our business. I hate reading reviews like this because I just want to hear about the food, but I just had to post this in hopes the owner sees it and responds.
Awesome for Mexican delivery. Portions are decent, especially for the prices. The fajitas were delicious. Service was quick and easy.

What an awesome Mexican food place! Had the "special sauce" and it was in indeed special. The margaritas are also phenomenal. The wait staff was pleasant and helpful. Really enjoyable experience from start to finish.

This spot has truly delicious food!! My favs are the campechanos tacos, smith street fries with steak, and the nopalito salad. Super tasty and the staff is great. Would highly recommend. They also have some of the best chips and salsa I've ever had!

Literally the best Mexican Food in BK. I lived in LA for a decade and struggled to find anything in NY that comes close to comparing. Purepecha is our go to at least once a every few weeks. Highly recommend.
This food is so. good!! If you are on the fence about the steak quesadilla, just get it, you deserve it.
No comment
Best Mexican place in the neighborhood. Â Good prices. Â Homemade tortillas!! Â Don't get that anywhere around here. Â Get the tacos or enchiladas, delicious!
Great tacos and outdoor seating! Loved the fajitas as well. Great service.

I find this to be my favorite mexican-style food in the neighborhood. Â I think their little touches add up to make a big difference. Â First, all their salsas and guacamole are delicious. Â I actually prefer the regular guac to the mocahete guac though. Â Their tortilla chips are thick, fresh made, and have that fantastic greasy salty sheen to them. Â For all their meat and fixings, the thing that sets them apart is they have FLAVOR! Â Meaning they are seasoned really nicely with salt and spices...I'm so surprised how often mexican-style restaurants don't do this well, especially with the grilled meat and refried beans. Â The food is extremely well packaged for takeout and arrives hot. Â A small amount of pico, guac, salsa, and sauce accompanies the orders in small ramekins. Â I look forward to eating here every time.

The food was average to above average but the service was not good and they nickle and dime you. The waiter never came back to check on our food, see if we wanted more water or drinks. Our favorite takeout & delivery spot. Everything is so good--burritos, quesadillas, all of it. Carnitas are crispy and the chicken tinga has the perfect kick. Food is ready fast and they'll make something just the way you want if you ask. So grateful for this place! Thanks for keeping us well-fed :)
Delicious, affordable neighborhood Mexican restaurant. Spacious bar area with good sized TVs and very friendly staff.

Amazing Mexican spot that opened in our neighborhood. Super fresh Mexican food, terrific quality and generous portions. Don't have liquor license yet so byob for now, but such a solid addition to the area!

Out of the Mexican restaurants in the area, this one stands out for its food quality. The San Angel burrito is my favorite, with tasty skirt steak, melted cheese topped with a pork gravy. The skirt steak steals the show. The Rancho burger is great too; hefty and with the necessary toppings to make a burger complete - bacon and cheese. Just be sure to mention how you'd like it cooked, as the default is a medium-well which can be too charred for my taste. It comes with fries, which makes it a great deal. The fries taste a bit like nachos, if that's your thing.
Food is amazing the corn tortillas give the tacos a big plus, everything I have tried so far is delicious!!!
Delicious !!! Finally a great Mexican restaurant on Smith st. Delicious tacos and burritos. Lovely on weekends and also have a great lunch menu Mon-Fri

Amazing Mexican food the food is so flavorful and tasty. I really enjoy the chicken fajita and my fiance gets the steak tacos. We love the quality and the tastiness of the food. Must try great outdoor seating as well for COVID-19!

Ordered food, took 3 hours to arrive and tasted like paper with some meat on it... not even close to the best Mexican spot in the neighborhood. If your in the area go somewhere else and save yourself the money

Have ordered take out and delivery from here and the food is so delicious! Their burritos and the chicken quesadilla are amazing. Large portions and fresh quality. The staff are also really friendly. A great new addition to the neighborhood :)
waited 2 hours and 45 minutes...i was told they were just busy and they food was on the way...then they cancelled the order... BEWARE!!!!!!

This review is for a Grubhub delivery order. It is difficult to judge the food on its own merit because the order took 1.5 hours and my friend and I were antsy by the time it arrived. I had to call the restaurant 3 times to check on it after they missed the estimated delivery time (that was already 45 mins to an hour - a conservative estimate for the burrito,chips and guac and salad we ordered). I was very excited to give this new place a try. The food was kind of "meh" after the long wait for it. Plenty of better places to order from in the neighborhood. Don't waste your time.
Mi sitio favorito!!! I love this place. The people are warm. The spicy margarita is off the hook. Mar y tierra buenÃ­simo.
Ordered food for a delivery. My order arrived very fast. The food was very delicious. Will def be ordering again!
